168001.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Menace of Runation story arc.

Kumanjaran Leopard

Creature
Cost 13 Mana
Health 10
Armor 1
Defense (Melee) 7+

Quick Attack Pounce: Melee, 3 Dice, Piercing + 1
Full Attack Wild Slashing: Melee, 3 Dice, Doublestrike

Elusive
168001.name: Mage Wars: Kumanjaran Leopard Promo Card

168002.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Menace of Runation story arc.

Leviathan Scale Armor

Equipment
Cost 6 Mana

Mage gains Armor + 2 and the Hydro - 2 trait.
168002.name: Mage Wars: Leviathan Scale Armor Promo Card

168003.name: Bestialwars
168003.description:
Bestialwars is a table-top fantasy miniature war game in heroic scale of 10mm {12mm real}, set in the lands of Zaneoss, continent of the flat world of Dabbath.

Bestial Wars is a stubborn game, carrying on the great tradition of the 80’s and 90’s, all miniatures are hand sculpted and casted using lead free metal.

...we just can’t help but love things that weigh !!!

Bestial Wars uses a 12mm scale for all its models, from troops to creatures. Thanks to the small size of the models, Bestial Wars battles are going to feel and look epic; furthermore, the limited number of bases in which miniatures are arranged will allow for fast and smooth deployment and movement.
This structure makes the grand battles of Bestial Wars playable with the ease of a skirmish game!

168004.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Menace of Runation story arc.

Sunfire Burst

Attack (light)
Cost 5 Mana
Ranged, 2 Dice, 6-7 Daze, 8+ Daze & Burn
Ethereal, Unavoidable

+ 2 vs. Nonliving Creatures
168004.name: Mage Wars: Sunfire Burst Promo Card

168005.name: Alien Invasion
168005.description: Alarm! The farmers and their animals on the farm are attacked by aliens. With much noise the animals are sucked into the spaceship by the aliens. Quickly bring the farmer and animals of your color into safety. Throw the dice and see how many places you can move them. Make use of the secret escape or hide in the toilet to escape the danger. Quickly run ... before it's too late!

168006.name: Duel of Legends
168006.description:
Duel of Legends is a combat card game where the players take on the roles of Legends of different class types. They use Weapon and Defense items, along with Spell cards to try and defeat their opponents and be the last legend standing.

Average play time per Duel is 5-10 mins (2 players). Turns are fast but every choice has game changing effects. Easy Learning Curve: Most players feel comfortable with the game after 1 or 2 Duels. The game mechanics are simple, it’s the choices you make that separate the beginners from the veterans.

Over 1200 Class:Equipment Combinations, over 1.3 million starting Combinations. (with spells) Up to 4 players: Adding more players changes the dynamic of the game dramatically. Deciding who to attack and when is a key factor. In the end there can be only one, so allies don’t stay allies long.

168007.name: The2101Game
168007.description:
The 21st Century's Explosive New Card Game! Move over Poker, there's a new card game in town! The2101Game! It's an exciting new card game that combines skill and luck with a unique twist to provide the ultimate card gaming experience. The2101Game is a very easy game to learn, and it can be played with as many as 11 players. The pot grows with rapid speed, giving every player an opportunity to win BIG! So if you're feeling lucky get your family, friends, and fellow gamers together and start playing The2101Game. The2101Game caters to people of all different gaming backgrounds. From the avid gamers to non-gamers alike, they all agree that The2101Game is one of the simplest yet most complex games that they have ever played. People who are typically and instantly drawn to this game are people who play poker, spades, rummy, Phase 10, and Uno although just having a general knowledge of cards is all you need to play The2101Game.

The2101Game is played with two decks of cards minus a 2 of diamonds, a 10 of clubs, and an Ace of spades.

To start play everyone is dealt 3 sets of cards which are 3 pocket cards (these cards go in your hand and are for your eyes only!), 3 face up cards, and 3 face down cards (which go over above the face up cards). The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all 9 of your cards by first playing all of your pocket cards, then all of your face up cards, then finally all of your face down cards. All you have to do is match or beat the card on the pile and if you can't, you pick up the entire pile and must play them all before you play any new cards unless you have "2101 cards", also referred to as wild cards. There are 3 "2101 cards" which are the 2, 10, and Ace. The 10 is the highest of the 3 cards. When played, the 10 clears the pile and also gives the player another turn. The Ace is the second highest "2101 card". It has no special powers but is just considered high. The lowest "2101 card" is the 2. When played the 2, also referred to as the "any card", starts the pile back low. It can be played on any card and any card can be played on top of it. You can only play your face up cards once you have no pocket cards left and you can only play your face down cards when you have no face up or pocket cards. Pocket cards must be played one at a time unless you have multiples. Multiple cards of the same value can be played together but is not mandatory and suits do not matter. Face Up cards must be played the same way but if you can not beat the card on the pile with one of your face up cards you must pocket that card that you were unable to play along with the entire pile. Face down cards are also played one at a time but once you touch a face down card that is the card you must use. If you can not beat the card on the pile with the chosen face down card you must pocket that card along with the entire pile.

The betting element is what makes the game more interesting. There are 4 betting stages. First the table bet (this is a predetermined amount to get cards (similar to an ante). Second bet is the pocket bet. This bet is made after the cards are dealt but before any cards are played and is initiated by the person with the highest set of face up cards. The "2101 cards" are what is typically looked for when determining who has the highest set of face up cards. The third bet is the face up bet. The face up bet is initiated by the first player to get to their face up cards without having any pocket cards. The fourth bet is the face down bet. The face down bet is initiated by the first person to get to their face down cards without having any face up or pocket cards. When a bet is initiated, starting to the left of the initiator, players must match the bet to continue in the round. Players also have the option to raise when their turn comes around. If a player does not want to make the bet they must fold their hand and forfeit any already wagered chips.


Note - once a player puts their bet on the table it can no longer be removed even if the player changes their mind and decides to fold. Betting in turn can significantly reduce the chances of this happening.



Note - When 4 cards of the same value are played on to the pile it constitutes a clear as a 10 would and also gives the player who played the fourth consecutive card another turn.

168009.name: Flagship Armada
168009.description:
4X Space boardgame revolving around assymetrical factions vying for control of the galaxy.

Each player plays a Faction and is set to a home system.

In this system, he needs to expand his fleet and colonies, so more resources are added to his growing empire.

At his side, each player has a powerful starship called Flagship. This ship research new modules, tactics and technologies.

But beware, other players are doing the same!

Struggle to survive against several threats like Pirates, Transdimensional invaders and opposite factions.

In the end, only one can achieve victory!

168010.name: Monster Kart Mayhem

rpghonor.26790: 2014 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee

168010.description:
From the back of the book:

Monsters, Start Your Engines!

Get ready for the Monster Mash, a speed race and battle royale of monstrous proportions. You’ll race across 1,000 kilometers of scenic Transylvania. Start by dodging your way past the Rolling Hills, maneuver your way through the Cliffs of Insanity, fend off gnashing piranha in the Scary Swamp, and even visit the grounds of Dracula’s Castle. The first monster to reach the Finnish Line (a line hailing from Finland) with their car intact wins.

In this Fudge™ System-compatible kart-racing family game, you’ll find:


9 unique racers with their own Perks and Quirks, including: Abominable Snowman, Big Foot, Count Dracula, El Chupacabra, and more.



Guidelines for creating your own racer if you prefer the Do-It-Yourself route.



9 Power-Ups to help you improve your chances of success, including Garlic Bombs, Piranha Launchers, Invisibility Cloaks, Super Buzz Saws, and more.



A race course that fights back—those trees in the Freaky Forest want revenge on woodcutters, but they’ll take you instead.


Monster Kart Mayhem is suitable for ages 8 and up.


in 2013 this was introduced as a RPG Geek Adventure Design Contest 2013 entry: Monster Kart Mayhem (RPGG Contest Entry)

168011.description:
Hver stal kökunni úr krúsinni? or Who stole the cookie from the cookie jar? is a card game inspired by the children's clap-song.
The goal is to find the vicious cookie thief!

If you happen to be the cookie thief your self you need to eliminate all other players or pass the empty jar to someone else!
The game is played in rounds and points given to players, minus point for being caught with the empty jar, plus point for having the best cake at the end of the game.

The game is illustrated with Icelandic Christmas cookies and cakes.
168011.name: Hver stal kökunni úr krúsinni?

168012.name: Pot Farm: The Board Game
168012.description:
Your Uncle Floyd has given you and a few of your buds land to grow some recreational crops.

Inspired by the Facebook cult underground hit, Pot Farm: The Board Game is a 2-4 player competitive farming game where farmers plant high risk/high reward plants while protecting themselves from the Ranger deck. Higher payout crops need higher protection or else the Ranger might come to seize them! Using successfully harvested weed, farmers can buy unique items from a rotating Store to enhance their farms in strategic ways. The game ends when the seed bag is empty. The highest valued farm becomes the ultimate Pot Farm!

Players draw from the included Hemp bag and place crop tokens on their farm placards. Just planting on your farm doesn't guarantee the crops safety from Ranger Dick and competing farmers! Successfully harvesting plant tokens to your stash allows players to afford wacky contraptions and buildings from the rotating store deck to place on their farms for awesome combos and boosts to their production.

168013.name: Twisted Kicks
168013.description:
Help your team guess the twisted words by describing and acting them out! The humor of Cards Against Humanity meets the style of Taboo.

How to play:

1. Split your group into two teams. One player starts first.
2. On your turn, draw a rule card. This rule applies to you during your turn.
3. Then, draw a twisted card. Get your team members to guess the word on your card. Describe it. Act it out. Just don’t read out the restricted words in the middle of the card.
4. If your team guesses the word, your team keeps that card. Keep drawing twisted cards until your 60-second turn ends. Then, it’s the other team’s turn.
5. Keep playing until everyone has a turn. The team that has the most cards at the end wins.

168014.name: Fishy Waters
168014.description:
User Summary

A young woman's father was taken by a giant kraken in open water. Now she has vowed revenge and will continue her fathers legacy by fishing. Catch fish to earn money and upgrade your boat and equipment. Help her save her father.

168015.name: Guilded Youth
168015.description:
You play Tony, a fourteen-year old thief who needs some help looting the legendary Oakville Manor. Luckily it’s the 1980s and finding fellow adventurers is just a modem squeal away…

Source: The Game Website.

168016.name: SpeakEasy a Bold Pub Game!
168016.description:
SpeakEasy is a game where players complete social missions. Most missions involve meeting people and making new friends. Others involve competing against your friends in outrageous challenges! Missions are printed on reusable coasters, which fit right in at your local bar, cocktail party, or picnic!

HOW DO I PLAY?
SpeakEasy is so simple to play, even an inebriate could learn! Here are the rules:

1. Draw a coaster. Read the mission out loud to the group.
2. Assign the mission to another player.
3. That player has 3 minutes to complete the mission.
4. If they succeed, they win the coaster. If they fail (or refuse!), you win it.
5. The first player to collect 5 coasters wins!

SAMPLE MISSIONS
SpeakEasy has over 25 missions. Each one is designed to stretch your social circle, and introduce you to new people! Here are some samples:

Comic Relief
"Target player must make a stranger laugh!"

Getting Fresh
"Choose two players. The first one to return with a piece of gum wins this coaster."

Playing with Matches
"Target player must introduce themselves to a stranger of your choice!"

168017.description: The Mirrors Promo Cards add an additional victory condition to the game. To win two of the mirrors (three for a harder game) have to be explored by playing four Location cards under each of them. Other mirror cards can be explored for their special effects.
168017.name: Onirim (second edition): Mirrors Promo Cards

168018.description:
This promo adds three new dream cards and additional nightmare cards to the game.

With the Sphinx you can guess for a symbol or a colour in the top five cards, put one card on the top of the deck and returning the other cards to the bottom of the deck.
The Diver lets you reveal cards from the bottom of the deck until you face a nightmare card or you choose to put the last revealed card on the top of the deck.
If you draw a Confusion card, you put your current hand at the bottom of the deck and draw a new hand.
168018.name: Onirim (second edition): Sphinx, Diver and Confusion Promo Cards

168019.name: The Mad Manor of Astabar
168019.description:
From publisher blurb:

For twenty years Astabar’s Manor sat abandoned, gaining notoriety as a cursed place of magic and danger. The good folk of Havehollow avoid it at all costs but at the behest of a beautiful and mysterious bard the characters venture forth to explore the home of the once great wizard.

The Mad Manor of Astabar is an epic Mini-Quest by Survive RPG and offers a compelling adventure that is great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests are designed for any D20 fantasy system. Also check out other free adventures like Beware The Wyvern Wood, Maze Of The Man Bull, The Hollowing Of Greyhaven, The Baron's Bastard, Song Of The Siren Queen, Rise Of The Vampire And Revenge Of The Kobold King.

168020.name: The Gold Legionaire
168020.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gold legionaries are the heroes and exemplars of a young nation full of hope. Expressing the hope and will of their country, the gold legionnaire shapes any group he leads or joins into a coherent force for good.

Prestige Class: Golden legionnaire.
Build Class: Fighter, Ranger

Role: Above all else, the Gold Legion’s duty is security; the Legion extensively trains its soldiers in defensive tactics and strategies that ensure the protection of both the people and other members of the Legion. That said, a typical gold legionnaire exhibits audacious courage, and unflinchingly puts himself between those he protects and possible threats.

168021.name: Hell's Horde
168021.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thirty-three pages of inspired madness from Monster Hunter fans and crowdfunding contributors.

168022.name: A Mess of Monsters
168022.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty-nine additional monsters for Monster Hunter International.

168023.name: Fantasy Roleplaying: An Omnibus of Opponents
168023.description:
From publisher blurb:

Face the danger! Prove your courage!

Fantasy Roleplaying: An Omnibus of Opponents is a collection of more than 100 new monsters, NPC enemies, and adversaries for Fantasy Heroic Roleplaying. This bestiary includes new takes on classic monsters, creatures from myth and legend, and brand new weird beasties to spice up any fantasy game.

168024.name: The Aigulf
168024.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can’t get enough of popular Pathfinder system? Neither can we… that’s why D3 Adventures has started the Campaign Toybox… monthly releases of new rules, classes, and creatures to enhance your gaming experience, all priced to be friendly to your wallet at a mere ninety-nine cents, so you can afford to stock up on munchies and more dice for your next gaming session!

This month’s Campaign Toybox details the Aigulf, a close-knit race of canids with a strong tradition of tribal families. This new race for the Pathfinder Roleplaying game comes complete with feats and a new Archetype; the Clan Skald. Get more in touch with your parties pack mentality today, all for less than the cup of java at your local coffee shop!

168025.name: Adventures in Monster Hunting
168025.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventures In Monster Hunting features six scenarios for the MHI RPG. Each of them is relatively simple and straightforward, perfect for new GMs and players to cut their teeth on but still plenty of fun for experienced GMs and players. They are:

The New Kids In Town, in which the PCs go into the field for the first time and find themselves taking on a nest of wererats
Gimme That Old One Religion, which pits the PCs against a cult that worships the Old Ones and is secretly controlled by a powerful necromancer named Vincent Scarlatti;
Bewitched, Bothered, And Bewildered, in which Scarlatti lures the PCs into a trap to try to get rid of them, while simultaneously attacking a local MCB facility to “recruit” monsters held captive there;
The Devil And The Deep Blue Sea, which puts the PCs in the middle of an occult war between Scarlatti and Lucinda Hood;
Soul Man, in which a grieving daughter asks the PCs to rescue her father’s soul from an oni, but who in truth has far more sinister motivations; and
Journey Of The Sorcerer, in which Vincent Scarlatti uses a powerful new body to try to complete a major summoning ritual before the PCs can stop him.

168026.name: Söldner, Skalden, Steppenelfen
168026.description:
(user summary)
This sourcebook gives you more than 60 NPSc from northern Aventurien to include into your campaign.

168027.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching the space marked 'Fire'
- moving by turns -
Typical 'Roll & Move' game

Turn the spinner: a '3' allows to enter the board. Step forward according spinner; ending on an orange marked space move 3 additonal steps forward;
ending on a white marked space detour over the red route
Note:
Likely published 1930s
168027.name: Fire Department

168028.name: Come About
168028.description:
In Come About players are maritime merchant traders in command of a fleet of trading ships navigating along many perilous trade routes. The player with the most ships along the most number of trade routes is declared “Nauclerokubernetes”, the Greek word for merchant-master.

Materials
64 double sided tiles, two sets of 32 tiles in two colors Red and Green.
A way of keeping score.

Play
Come About is played on a board-less playing surface.

Two players Red and Green have each two sets of 16 double sided tiles in their chosen color.

Red starts by placing a tile either side up onto the table.
Players then take turns placing a tile alongside another existing tile, connecting trade routes ( the dotted lines) across tile edges.

The game ends when all the tiles have been played.

A trade route is a continuous dotted line or loop containing 3 or more ships in either players color.

The player having the majority of ships in his color on a trade route scores 1 point for each of his ships. If a trade route has an equal number of ships in both colors, then neither player scores along that trade route.

The player with the highest score wins.

168029.name: Murano: Promo Cards
168029.description:
A set of three promo cards one got when purchasing of the game at the Lookout stand in Essen 2014.


Campanile/Bell Tower: You receive 5 VPs immediately.
Markthalle/Market Hall: Every time you use the income action, you receive 2 more gold.
Ratsstube/Council Hall: You only have to pay 1 gold to purchase a special building.

168030.name: Darkwater Station
168030.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a Water Treatment Plant, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play and a 360 degree view from the center of the plant.

“The water is bubbling. Interesting….AAAHHH!”

Do you dare to visit Darkwater Station where murky, polluted waters are reclaimed for use by civilization?

Darkwater Station is a single external map of an industrial plant with a canal basin of dark water spanned by two bridges and surrounded by three buildings, a garage, and industrial equipment.

Darkwater Station is intended for use in modern and near future science fiction games. It could be used in a far future science fiction game on a more backwater planet. The dark water canal has a potential use in Horror games as well.

Darkwater Station can be used in myriad ways. It could be used as a hydroelectric dam, a desalination plant, or a water filtration plant as some examples.

Adventure hook for use with this product:

It Came From the Dark Water: The water kept getting murkier and cloudier every day. HydroDamics couldn’t care less as long as the dam kept working and the power stayed on so they could fleece their customers for every watt they used.

Eventually the pollutants got so bad that it clogged the dam up. The two monitoring and relay stations of the facility put out an emergency message to the main corporation HQ for urgent help fixing the problem.

Soon the failed dam started affecting the grid, causing a massive power outage. Every second the water was stalled, HydroDamics was losing money and customer trust in their grid. HydroDamics decided to send in a team of the best scientists and engineers they could to figure out the problem and fix it. But when they got to the facility they found the checkpoint outside unguarded and the facility covered in a black ichor as the pumps failed and the water slowly flooded the plant.

They entered the facility. The engineers got the pumps working again. Their scientist saw bubbles in the canal. He got closer to the water to investigate the phenomena. Then the dark water erupted, snagging the scientist, and pulling him into the dark depths. The dark water surged towards the engineers at the pumps and enveloped them next. The last communication HydroDamics had with the team was a desperate cellphone call for help from the last surviving engineer before his cellphone went dead with a scream of terror.

HydroDamics has assembled a new team of eggheads and this time they have sent in mercenaries to guard them. Will this new team figure out what is going on or meet the same fate as the first team? Everyone going in knows that there is someone or something lurking in the dark water...

boardgameimplementation.173323: Character Quest: Heroes – Goblin Raiders Adventure

174510.name: Character Quest: Desert Warrior's Hero Set

boardgameintegration.173322: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #2: Savage Beasts

168031.description:
Goblins are pillaging the countryside. Heroes are lining up to gain loot and fame. Which player will have the most successful hero tavern in the land?

In Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1 – King's Guard, up to four players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern. From the mighty Paladins and Wardens of the King's Guard Tavern to the powerful Great Wolves and Berserkers of the Savage Beasts Tavern, each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

Only one deck is needed for up to four players; extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share. Despite the "TCG" in the title, the components of the items in the game are fixed, not randomly distributed.
168031.name: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1: King's Guard

boardgamecompilation.156413: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Beach Card Mini Expansion

168032.description:
User Summary:

Special package of several English Mini Expansions for Robinson Crusoe.


Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Beast Cards
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Beach Card Mini Expansion
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Sailor character (with a pawn and stickers)
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Tracing Doctor Livingstone
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Dreadful adventure on the King Kong Island
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Spyglass of Illusory Hope
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island - Trait Cards I
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island - Trait Cards II


Plus some extras:

Robinson Crusoe: Stickers for Pawns
Voyage of the Beagle: Pawns and stickers
Wooden pawns (bananas, bread, wood, fur ..)
168032.name: Robinson Crusoe: Promo pack

121921.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island

boardgamefamily.26563: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island

168033.name: 29 Lets Go!
168033.description:
29, Let's Go! is the first Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End.

Thirty-two pages long, 29, Let's Go! contains an overview of the planned, and then actual, events on Omaha beach on the 6th of June before then going on to present a mini-campaign covering the advance of the US 175th Infantry Regiment from the initial beachhead in their drive to link Omaha and Utah beaches by capturing the key bridge at Isigny.

The campaign is a total of five game tables with the duration running between five and nine games. Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

168034.description:
The Castle of the Keys has been a center of power since ancient times and then served as a lair for Pyromalfic, a dragon of immeasurable power. Multiple armies converged on the castle to wage a war of mutual obliteration, forcing Pyromalfic to the surface for his cataclysmic last stand. This battle shook the foundations of western Immoren. Will you endure it or be destroyed?

Customize your deck with powerful new cards and take command of the pivotal events of this historic war in the Castle of the Keys campaign expansion. Recreate one of the wars that changed the face of the Iron Kingdoms, and rewrite history!
168034.name: Hordes: High Command – Castle of the Keys Campaign Expansion

168035.name: At the Sharp End
168035.description:
At the Sharp End is designed to provide all you need to play and create wargame campaigns with Chain of Command.

At the Sharp End allows you to follow the exploits of your force throughout a series of linked games. To succeed you'll need to keep your men safe, your CO happy whilst ensuring the effectiveness of your key leaders. Included is a complete campaign system covering everything you need to run a campaign with an absolute minimum of effort and paperwork (almost none in fact).

Three types of campaign options are presented so the gamer can select one to suit the amount of time he has available and the degree of detail he is looking for. The most simple option allows the gamer to start campaigning straight away, whilst the others allow the building of historical campaigns. It's all there, even down to gallantry awards so you can see your characters develop in action.

168036.name: Operation Winter Storm
168036.description:
Operation Winter Storm is a scenario supplement providing twenty-two scenarios covering the attempts by 6 Panzer Division to advance across the bleak steppes towards Stalingrad and relieve von Paulus' trapped Sixth Army.

Each scenario comes with a briefing for both sides, victory conditions and a map of the table. Two support options are given for each force as well as five Army lists to cover the forces involved. The scenarios are arranged into four chapters allowing the gamer to play them individually or as a series of linked games.

This PDF supplement is designed to be both user and printer-friendly. Only the maps are in colour, keeping the ink usage low, and each side's briefing and game notes are on one sheet of paper, allowing the gamer to simply print out three sheets for each scenario and get playing.

188781.name: Good Cop Bad Cop Equipment Pack: Protect

168037.description: In Good Cop Bad Cop: Bombers and Traitors, an expansion to the hidden identity and deduction game Good Cop Bad Cop, players may still be either Honest or Crooked cops, but two new roles are added: Traitor and Suicide Bomber. Honest and Crooked players are still trying to eliminate the opposing team's leader to win the game, the Suicide Bombers are trying to be eliminated before the leaders, and the Traitors are trying to remain alive when one of the leaders goes down. The expansion also expands the game down to 3-8 players.
168037.name: Good Cop Bad Cop: Bombers and Traitors

168038.name: A Body Was Found
168038.description:
From publisher blurb:

No one is surprised that something mysterious and terrible has happened in the town of Pinebox, Texas. The residents of Pinebox and students of East Texas University have come to call this incident “The Happening”. Your group is setting out to uncover the mysteries of “The Happening”… hopefully without making things worse.

A Body Was Found… is an RPG game using the Protocol framework and set in East Texas University.

168039.name: Bill Shakespeare Is Dead
168039.description:
Bill Shakespeare is Dead is a highbrow/lowbrow party game for at least 5 players. There are variants for 3 and 4 players.

Transport yourself back to 17th century England. Ah, the good old days. The smell of feces and dead hobos in the street. The sight of unwashed masses and the complete lack of hygiene. Isn’t it lovely? You and your fellow players are members of the King’s Men, and you make your living saying pretty words to hundreds of filthy people. Better than digging ditches, right? Well tonight is supposed to be the opening night of a brand new play. The crowds are already gathered in the Globe Theatre, and the only thing missing is your star playwright, Bill Shakespeare. As it turns out, Bill had a little too much pickled herring and a lot too much wine and is as dead as disco. Now, armed with nothing but patches of the new script and (sometimes obscene) scribbles in the margins, you all need to put on a show. Good luck!

In Bill Shakespeare is Dead, one of Shakespeare’s famous plays is split into five short acts. During each act, one person acts as the Stage Manager, and two people are randomly chosen to act out the scene. As they go through the script, the rest of the players will have to fill in missing nouns and verbs randomly drawn from the deck and helpfully shouted when there is a blank part in the script. The Stage Manager chooses which nouns and verbs go where. At the end, you can tally your points and declare a winner, if that’s your sort of thing.

168040.name: Hals und Beinbruch!
168040.description:
Hals und Beinbruch! sets forth simple rules which may be used in conjunction with either TSR’s Fight in the Skies or Avalon Hill’s Richtofen’s War in order to run an extended campaign.

Includes a 4 page pamphlet of rules, tables and designer's notes as well as bound British and German logbooks.

168041.name: Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips (Fifth Edition)
168041.description:
From publisher blurb:

Countless people have benefitted from Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips, the most exotic collection of lesser magical spells the multiverse has ever seen, and now it is ready for the next generation of dungeon delvers. Herein are over 90 unique cantrips that can add a little spice to your game, and encourage role playing.

Additionally, Master Gothnog has included two new related feats and a bardic college so that you can make the most of these cantrips immediately.

This material is compatible with the most recent edition of the most popular fantasy role playing game in history.

Check back for more curious additions to the library of Gothnog.

168042.name: Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips, Volume 1
168042.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips is the most exotic collection of lesser magical spells the multiverse has ever seen. Herein are over 50 unique cantrips that can add a little spice to your game, and encourage role playing.

Check back for more curious additions to the library of Gothnog.

168043.name: Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips, Volume 2: Divine Cantrips
168043.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips: Volume 2 explores the virtually untapped realm of Divine Cantrips. Included here are new zero level spells for the divine spell caster, as well as two new feats to enhance your total cantrip experience.

Check back for more curious additions to the library of Gothnog.

168044.name: Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips, Volume 3: Merchants & Crafts
168044.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gothnog's Magnificent Cantrips: Volume 3 is a collection of specialized cantrips for those we often take for granted. Namely those hard working folk who provide the goods and services we use on a regular basis as professional adventurers. These were some of the first spells that Gothnog acquired during his early days as a traveling merchant and scholar of the lesser arcane arts. Unlike most cantrips, these have been divided up into reputable spells used by your average, upstanding shop owner, and disreputable spells used by those of questionable character.

168045.name: Gothnog's Remarkable Spells: Uncanny Expansion
168045.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gothong’s Remarkable Spells takes spell casting to a whole new level. These spells have been created by some of the most brilliant wizards of all time, places and dimensions, and have been collected — often at great personal risk — by Gothnog himself. Each installment contains only one spell, but each promises to be so beneficial to any arcane caster who decides to study them, there will be little doubt that it was worth the additional time and expense.

One of the most remarkable aspects of these spells is that they evolve with the caster, becoming more and more useful as time goes on. For that reason, some have started calling them “legacy spells.” The cost for their exceptional usefulness is that the casting of these spells becomes correspondingly more complex, time
consuming and expensive as their power increases.

Another thing that sets these spells apart is that they do not operate within any traditional school of magic. The reason for this is not known, though some speculate that it is because they tend to access multiple
schools simultaneously, while others believe that they tap into a different kind of magic entirely.

Unlike Gothnog’s Magnificent Cantrips, these spells are not for the casual caster or arcane dabbler. Only serious arcane practitioners should attempt to learn and employ these formidable incantations.

This first spell is called Uncanny Expansion, and it allows the caster to increase the amount of useable space in almost any given vessel. This spell may one day make the Bag of Holding obsolete.

Please note that neither Gothnog, nor anyone involved with the publication of these spells, is responsible for any harm resulting from their use... or misuse. Good luck.

168046.name: Gothnog's Extraordinary Classes, Volume 1: The Drifter
168046.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Drifter is the classic jack-of-all-trades and dabbler in the lesser arcane arts known as cantrips. Drifters have the ability to adapt to most situations through rapid learning, mimicry, and sheer bluff. Whether you need a warrior, scribe, or a blacksmith, the drifter will give it a shot.

Check back for more curious additions to the library of Gothnog.

168047.name: The Lost Crypt
168047.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epic Adventures Maps (by artist cartographer Maxime PLASSE) present you the Lost Crypt !

This highly detailed dungeon map is perfect for a short one session dungeon game. The isometric view and its strong visual impact will bring undoubtely some epic mood in your game session !

This PDF allows you to print the dungeon as a color A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version.

You can use any of the images from the resource in your personnal or non-commercial project.

168048.name: Down into the Sewers
168048.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epic Adventures Maps (by artist cartographer Maxime PLASSE) present you the Sewers !

This highly detailed dungeon map is perfect for a short one session dungeon game. The isometric view and its strong visual impact will bring undoubtely some epic mood in your game session !

This PDF allows you to print the dungeon as a color A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version.

You can use any of the images from the resource in your personnal or non-commercial project.

168049.name: The Knight's Chamber
168049.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epic Adventures Maps (by artist cartographer Maxime PLASSE) present you the Knight's Chamber !

This highly detailed dungeon map is perfect for a short one session dungeon game. The isometric view and its strong visual impact will bring undoubtely some epic mood in your game session !

This PDF allows you to print the dungeon as a color A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version.

You can use any of the images from the resource in your personnal or non-commercial project.

168050.description: A first in utilizing the franchise and its concepts of "Light vs. Dark" in designing a deckbuilder. Players start with a deck loaded with emotion; light and dark; and set on a path to recruit heroes of the light side and villains of the dark side in a quest to speed to planets across the galaxy and complete missions for the glory of the rebellion (or the empire?). Decide the fate of the galaxy in Star Wars: The Deckbuilder. For 2-5 players, apx. 20 mins. per player. First game in a newly designed Deck builder model.
168050.name: Star Wars: The Deckbuilder

168051.name: My Life as a Card Game
168051.description: Collectible card game depicting players' lives! Build your deck around your life's greatest accomplishments, your goals, dreams and failures. Be the most successful as you tell your life's story in duel and multi-player formats! The game "ends" when one players life (deck) runs out! Count up your accomplishments and the winner is the one who's lived the "best" life. Variable scoring options entice ccg hobbists to build different deck types and play themselves...or as the person they'd like to be!

168054.description:
Grifters is a hand-building game that has all the fun of deck-building games, without the deck. Set in the Dystopian Universe, players take on the role of powerful crime bosses, building their criminal organizations by carefully recruiting new operatives with specialized skills and directing their team’s nefarious deeds. All of your specialists are either in play or in your hand, ready to be used as you command. This unique hand-building mechanism gives you total control of your strategy.

Grifters is all about stealing as much money as you can from the corrupt government, malicious corporations, and your rival players. Each player starts the game with a hand of six Specialist cards, each with unique abilities. Your objective is to use this team of six Specialists to recruit more criminals, complete jobs, steal from the government coffers and swindle your opponents.

Each specialist has a special ability and skill. On your turn you can play a single specialist to perform their ability, or you can play a team of specialists to use their combined skills to complete a job. This means every specialist is a valuable asset to your criminal enterprise, earning immediate benefit through abilities and valuable end-game bonuses by completing jobs against the same target. And because all the cards in your deck are always available, you decide how to maximize your play.

Grifters uses a unique card "cooldown" system to control the use of your cards. On your turn, you play one or more specialist cards into the first "Night" of your hideout. If you already have a specialist card, or a team of specialist cards, in night one those cards advance to night two and push other cards through your hideout.

When a card is pushed out of the third night of your hideout it enters the refresh area. Any cards in your refresh area will return to your hand at the end of your turn.

The game ends when the coffers run out of money, there are no more jobs left to complete, or if there are no more specialists cards left for recruiting. End game bonuses are calculated for completing multiple jobs against the same target. The player with the most money wins.

---

The Grifters (1st Ed) was first released via Kickstarter with the following backer exclusives:

Upgraded player tableaus - A thick chipboard tableau with linen finish will replace the cardstock tableaus found in the base game.

4 x New "Ringleader" cards - Informants are a new ringleader (every player starts with one of each of the ringleaders) that add an element of bluff and deception to the game.

With Informants in play, you can play any card face down and take the Informant action. Any other player may challenge the Informant. When challenged, the active player reveals the card that was played. If that card is the Informant, the challenger must give the active player 2M ISK. If that card is not the Informant, no payments are due from any player to the active player, the challenger steals 2M ISK from the active player and gets to take the action on the card that was played.

Informants are a really fun addition to the game and totally fitting with the Dystopian Universe.

A set of these promo specialist cards.

You are Awesome - Bonus #1: 3 x The Security Specialist promo
You are Awesome - Bonus #2: 3 x Crooked Warden promo
You are Awesome - Bonus #3: 3 x Veteran promo
You are Awesome - Bonus #4: 3 x Underboss promo
You are Awesome - Bonus #5: 3 x Negotiator promo
168054.name: Grifters

168055.name: Roots: A Game of Inventing Words
168055.description: Roots is a game of inventing words. Players combine Prefix and Suffix cards to create new words, competing for the best connection to a Subject card. Whoever delivers the best explanation for their word captures that Subject card, gaining a potential piece of their secret Win condition. But stay sharp: players can manipulate each other's progress with various Power cards, undermining opponents while advancing themselves. The result is narrative warfare in which the most creative, best spoken, and craftiest thrive.

168056.name: Star Ship Battles
168056.description: An adaptation of 2D ship combat rules for use with any size models. Ships are constructed by using a formula table in the rulebook based on their relative size, weapons fit, arc of fire, speed, etc. Models often used are from other systems and the rules create fun, engaging battles across a space grid in a short amount of time relative to other, more robust systems.

168057.description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion.

The fierce campaign has taken it’s toll on waring daimyos. After suffering defeat, they are forced to regroup in their Bakufu (war tent) to plan new strategies. With renewed vigor, the warlords return to the battlefield with a stronger thirst for conquest.

In Rise of the Daimyo, players acquire Tactic cards after unsuccessful conquests. These Tactic cards are used on later turns to give players more control of future conquests.
168057.name: Rise of the Daimyo (fan expansion for Age of War)

168058.description: 14" x 24" neoprene playmat that provides designated spaces for the trade row and decks and discard piles for two players.
168058.name: Star Realms: Playmat

168060.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Who couldn't use a bag of zombie animals. Six different animals: Lions, tigers, polar bears, hyenas, gorillas and monkeys. 90 figures total.
168060.name: Zombies!!!: Bag o' Animals!!!

168061.name: Colour Wheel
168061.description: Colour Wheel is a simple to learn, easy to play card game that teaches ROYGBIV color theory. The object is to be the first to have no cards left in your hand. Players lay down cards to make an ever-expanding wheel, creating a unique work of art every time it's played.

168063.name: iPod
168063.description:
The iPod is a line of portable media players and multi-purpose pocket computers designed and marketed by Apple Inc. Like other digital music players, iPods can serve as external data storage devices. Storage capacity varies by model, ranging from 2 GB for the iPod Shuffle to 128 GB for the iPod Touch (previously 160 GB for the iPod Classic, which is now discontinued).

Source: Wikipedia, "https://www.en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPod";, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

168064.name: Polar Rush!
168064.description:
A fierce blizzard is fast approaching, but young Kaya and his friends are still fishing out on the ice far from their igloos! The little Inuit need to pack up and rush home as quickly as they can. However, their journey back is fraught with many dangers. Heavy snow and strong winds make it difficult for them to find the shortest route back, the ice beneath them could break apart at any time, and hungry polar bears are lurking nearby! Using clever planning and a keen memory, can you be the first to navigate your Inuit across the ice floes and back to the safety of their igloo?

In Polar Rush!, seven ice floe tiles are placed together on the table to form the game board. On each ice floe are seven different animals or items found in the arctic. Movement tiles are spread out face down on the table. On a turn, a player reveals a number of movement tiles one at a time based on the number rolled on the die. If he reveals a "seal" and a seal is adjacent to his current position, he must move his Inuit to the "seal" (even if it means he must move backwards); if a seal isn't nearby, he doesn't move.

The floes also feature special characters that can help (or hamper) a player's movement, so with clever planning your movement can be quite successful. For example, if you move to a sled, your next move doesn't need to be to an adjacent tile — but if you reveal a "crack" tile, you can separate the game board to create a water gap between the floes. The only way to cross this is to reveal a kayak tile. The first person to get his Inuit home wins!

Polar Rush! includes simplified rules for Inuit as young as five as well as more complex rules for older Inuit.

168066.name: Postmortem: One Must Die
168066.description:
What is Postmortem?

Indie game playing an Agent of Death who must take ONE life that could change the fate of a conflict-torn Nation! Think The Walking Dead meets Home and The Last Express, with a dash of To The Moon!

Freeform exploration with Rich dialogue
What might you learn searching the fundraising Gala and talking to patrons? Perhaps the less you know the better?

Meaningful choices and Unintended Consequences
Can your choice change the fate of a Nation? What other result could your meddling have?

Cast of ambitious and influential characters
What if they die? More importantly... what if they live?

Complex setting of violent domestic conflict and industrial revolution
A devastated country - but is it your place to fix it? What if your educated guess is wrong?

Dynamic and surprising Ending
The choice is *entirely* up to you - but what other factors may be affecting the outcome?

Online Stats to compare Your Choices with
Anonymous aggregate stats of everyone's playthroughs will let you see how your own choices compare! Are you one of the good guys?

Source: The Game Website.

168067.name: Chaos Domain
168067.description:
Chaos Domain is a game about shooting bad people in the face.

Apart from that, it is also a run and gun platformer, powered by Unreal Engine. The game is highly influenced by games from 8-bit and 16-bit era, including Contra/Probotector series, as well as titles like Abuse and Doom Troopers.

The game is set on a huge spaceship occupied by chaos cultists, where the main character (who clearly looks like a hi-tech version of the god Anubis) must kill everyone in sight. The game is obviously not story-driven, it’s all about action.

Players can upgrade and purchase weapons and special items that can boost their performance.

Source: The Developer Website.

168068.name: Culling of the Cows
168068.description:
With his dusty old 12 gauge at his side and god at his back, Sammy isn’t going to be taking too kindly to the infectious chaos of the big city’s leaking its way out into wild country. When all the lunacy started Sammy consulted God on what he should do, and his response was. KILL THEM! KILL THEM ALL!!!!

Features


Full Controller support
Steam Achievements
Fast paced action mixed with strategic gameplay
40 levels of critters that need a good butchering
Plough your way through herds of shamblers and ravenous cattle
Easy accessible for all gamers
Easy to pick up and play, but challenging


Source: The Developer Website.

168069.name: Infested Sewer
168069.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all dungeons feature the traditional setup of a monster-filled subterranean network of rooms and passages. Woodland groves, haunted houses, druid groves and more can all serve as an exciting backdrop to the PCs’ adventures. Such locations present their own set of unique design challenges, though, for the time-crunched GM plotting the next adventure.

This instalment of Alternate Dungeons presents loads of great details, hints and tips for a GM designing an adventure set in an infested sewer. Designed to save a GM’s time while adding flavoursome details to bring the locale alive in the player’s minds, Alternate Dungeons: Infested Sewer is an essential tool in any GM’s arsenal. Alternate Dungeons: Infested Sewer presents:

Infested Sewer: An Alternate Dungeon
Infested Sewer: Dressing
Infested Sewer: Denizens
Infested Sewer: Traps & Hazards
Infested Sewer: Adventure Hooks

168071.name: Carnival of Sinners
168071.description:
From publisher blurb:

A misty autumn morning in a small city reveals the streets paved with crude decorative parchments. The gaudy script announces the arrival of the Carnival of Sinners the following day, and the twisted drawings make promise of horrors never witnessed.

The Carnival of Sinners is a free Halloween release from Fat Goblin Games. This book details a horrific carnival that can be used in any Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game. Included in this release are an overview of the Carnival of Sinners, details on the layout of the carnival, a map, sample carnival slang, adventure hooks, stats and bio on a variety of the traveling shows performers, unusual prizes and items for carnival games, and player aids (such as tickets, flyers, and maps).

168072.name: Exotic Races #01: Spellwarped
168072.description:
From publisher blurb:

All-new from Octopus Apocalypse, Exotic Races #01: Spellwarped

Presenting the Spellwarped, an all-new race of hideously deformed race for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
Twisted by arcane forces while in the womb, spellwarped are powerful arcane mutants set apart from human society by their monstrous deformities.

Inside you'll find:

The Spellwarped Race, with alternate racial traits and favored class options.
The Savage Monster barbarian archetype
Racial equipment and spells.
12 racial feats.
20 Greater mutations for customizing your spellwarped characters. Everything from gills, to claws, to spinnerets!
16 Minor mutations (each with multiple options) for further customizing your very own hideously deformed monster hero.
Random mutation generation tables! because that's the only way to roll a mutant.
Original full-color illustrations.




All this and more, in Exotic Races #01: Spellwarped!

168073.name: Katalál Area Map & Gazetteer
168073.description:
From publisher blurb:

This booklet details one mega-hex of map (133 x 120 km) located around Katalal - the default starting place for Bethorm RPG characters. It includes descriptions of many local sites, providing a wealth of adventure hooks for any new Bethorm campaign! Usable in any Tekumel-based game.

168074.name: Agents of SECTOR
168074.description:
To better combat the rising tide of terrorism and threats around the globe, a new commission has formed. Comprised of elite teams from several intelligence agencies of the United States, SECTOR is mandated with the front-line defense of freedom and liberty.

But someone has to lead this organization, and you plan on being the one chosen as Administrator. So be prepared to defend against espionage and sabotage… and to commit acts of both to come out on top!

Over 12 rounds (weeks), each player will choose to place their three agents to perform one of the following options:

Perform an Action
Work a Mission
Get Help from The Agency
Play a Resource
Appropriate Resources

Managing resources wisely and completing missions will gain you Merit Points. Direct, make shady deals and even sabotage other agencies to become the best! The best managed agency at the end of the 12th week/round is the person who has earned the most merit points.

168075.name: Teardrop Grav Tank
168075.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is the TL10 Grav Tank Teardrop.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

168076.description: This include 18 extra regular cards to beef up your deck for playing Laser Cat Attack! for 5 or 6 players.
168076.name: Laser Cat Attack! 5-6 player Add-on

168077.description:
Panini America, the leading global publisher of licensed sports and entertainment collectibles, is bringing the popular Dragon Ball Z card game back to the market for the first time since 2004.
The 2014 edition features more than 200 new cards, reprints of past fan favorites and is completely compatible with the original series. The new game was developed by Panini America Brand Manager Aik Tongtharadol, a former Dragon Ball Z world champion who also worked on the original Dragon Ball Z Trading Card Game, most recently in 2004.
168077.name: Dragon Ball Z TCG (2014 edition)

168078.description:
Originally the game is delivered with a blank die and two sticker sets (One extra set in reserve).

A laser etched die can be ordered to spice up the game.
168078.name: Laser Cat Attack!: Laser etched Cat Nip Die

168079.name: Kasernenleben
168079.description:
Objective: be the first arriving at target space 50
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game;
translation of the title "Barracks life".

remarks: the theme seems not to be a perfect platform for a 'Children's game', but the educational touch of the rules well.

168082.name: Intendentes
168082.description:
In this exciting game each player performs the role of a mayor of a large district of the province of Buenos Aires in Argentina Republic. As such, you must lay out and manage the resources of his district and try to grow as much as you can.

Each construction that takes place in the game has its advantages and disadvantages, possible to levy taxes or produce food, but also increase the risks of the district making it more prone to flooding, fire, or be unsafe. The population grows and reproduces. Keep her happy as much as you can.
Maintaining a balance between growth and lack of control is not easy.

Some districts in Argentina are really large, and among them may be several cities, towns and even large crop fields, ranches and farms.

Intendentes is a turn-based game. The game consists of 10 rounds, and each round turn is divided into 8 phases.

During the game each mayor takes "blocks" through auctions which are built in his district. Each block has its own characteristics, may be a village, a city, an agricultural field, industry, or a unique and special block.

Each of these blocks gives something to the district, ability to accommodate much population, collect taxes or produce food.

In return, each block increases the risk levels of the district, level of crime, fire and flood. These are common problems that affect a large districts of Argentina.

It's also imprtant building blocks police and firefighters to combat these problems.

Each mayor manages its population, distributed in the blocks and choose their destinations.

Also, "plans" which are actions that directly interfere on their own district or on a "neighbor" are acquired. Choosing the right time to use makes a difference.

In the course of time various events can affect all the mayors and depending on the level of risk that each district suffer, can be affected and prejudiced in their progress.

The way each mayor manage his district, impacts the discomfort of the population, it is even likely that the population is so upset that perform mass protests against us, affecting our splendor.

The objective of the game is to be the mayor with the district most splendid of all.

168083.name: Dwimmermount Illustration Book
168083.description:
From the back cover:

A picture may be worth a thousand words – but a dungeon with more than a thousand rooms still requires a lot of pictures.

The Dwimmermount Illustration Book includes a complete set of illustrations of the Dwimmermount megadungeon’s most essential features and locations, designed to be shown to the players in the style of the classic adventures of old.

Featuring artwork hand-selected by dungeon creator James Maliszewski, the Illustration Book has over 40 different works by top artists including Jeff Dee, Mark Allen, Eric Quigely, Conor Nolan, John Larrey, Steve Zieser, Russ Nicholson, Kelvin Green, and the grand master of old-school fantasy, Erol Otus. Bring Dwimmermount to life with illustrations ready to be used right at your gaming table!

This is not a standalone product. A copy of Dwimmermount™ is required to run the dungeon. Dwimmermount is a 13-level megadungeon for Adventurer Conqueror King System™, Labyrinth Lord™ and other d20-based fantasy role-playing games, available for purchase separately from Autarch™ LLC.

168084.name: Dwimmermount Map Book
168084.description:
From the back cover:

Few adventurers who ever enter the legendary halls of Dwimmermount ever return. Its dangers are too great – its mysteries unplumbed. If only a map were at hand – or better, a dozen maps, one for every level of the dungeon…

Dwimmermount™ is a classic megadungeon and old-school campaign setting presented for use with Labyrinth Lord™ and other d20-based fantasy role-playing games.

The Dwimmermount Map Book presents each of Dwimmermount's wilderness, dungeon, and fortress maps as a two-page spread for reference and annotation in play. It’s an indispensable reference when running a dungeon that’s large enough to encompass an entire campaign! The Dwimmermount Map Book also includes a special two-page visual timeline of the construction of Dwimmermount, showing its origins in the early First Era to its final completion millennia later.

This is not a standalone product. A copy of Dwimmermount™ is required to run the dungeon. Dwimmermount is a 13-level megadungeon for Adventurer Conqueror King System™, Labyrinth Lord™ and other d20-based fantasy role-playing games, available for purchase separately from Autarch™ LLC.

168086.name: Dwimmermount: The Dungeon Tracker
168086.description:
From the back cover:

The Dwimmermount Megadungeon Tracker is a unique play-aid designed to help you get the most out of all 13 levels of Dwimmermount. For each level of the dungeon, the Megadungeon Tracker provides a double-sided laminated reference sheet, with a specially keyed map on one side and a level summary on the other. The map provides brief descriptions and contents for each room on the level; the level summary covers each level’s history, factions, wandering monsters, access points, and special areas, and allows the gamemaster to easily track turns and marching order.

This is not a standalone product. A copy of Dwimmermount™ is required to run the dungeon. Dwimmermount is a 13-level megadungeon for Adventurer Conqueror King System™, Labyrinth Lord™ and other d20-based fantasy role-playing games, available for purchase separately from Autarch™ LLC.

168087.name: Freiburg
168087.description:
From the back of the book:

-Description of the city Freiburg, Maps and NSCs
-Informations about Freiburg's laws, government an society
-History of the city
-Campaign "Hammer und Zange"
-A2 map of central Freiburg
-Cityguide "Willkommen in Freiburg"

admin comment
for the English Boxed Set publication see: Freiburg

168088.name: The Other Side: A Global Conflict Resolution Game
168088.description:
User Summary
This game is a simulation of multiple nations trying to build bridges between each other. The nations must search, drill and trade for 3 different kinds of oil. In order to prosper a nation needs the kind of oil that can only be drilled for in the other nation. Stagnant economies will activate A nations' "Computer assisted Defense" system. This system will cause conflict with the other side for a short period of time. Communication between the countries are through a limited computer "Hotline". The game can be played either cooperatively or competitively. In coop mode the object is to build the bridge as quick as possible. In competitive mode the winner is the nation that adds the last brick to the bridge.

The game can be played hotseat style by two players on one computer or by up to four players on two connected computers.

Two map/game boards with erasable makers, Two player's guides and an Instructor's guide originally came with the game.

168089.name: Mit Zippo durch Herten
168089.description:
Mit Zippo durch Herten is an educational game for children and families that has players move through and discover the city of Herten, North Rhine-Westphalia.

The game board is a map of the city. Traffic lights can hinder movement and players need to reach colored spaces that are placed in key locations and places of interest within the city.
It is also possible for players to anwser "Herten allgemein" (Herten in general) cards or play event cards to gain benefits or hinder other players.

Each player has a secret goal, which has him or her gather a number cards of different colors. Each color corresponds to different institutions, from recreational facilities to public services. A player gains a card when he enters a space of the same color on the board and then correctly answers the question given on it.

In doing so, the players get to know the layout of the city and learn about locations, services and activities.

168090.description:
Dead Meat: Quarantine Zone America Dead Meat is an action-packed tabletop skirmish game, where human factions compete in the ruined wasteland of the zombie apocalypse.

Dead Meat is a 28mm, tabletop skirmish game set 4 years after a massive pandemic has toppled society and set man against man. While zombies are an ever-present threat, other groups of survivors pose a much greater danger – you’ll soon learn that the dead are the least of your problems.

This focus on battles between groups of survivors is one of the things that sets Dead Meat apart from many of the current offerings in the zombie game genre. While zombie-bashing is a lot of fun, the real horror of the genre comes from the lengths people are willing to go to in order to survive. Dead Meat brings this terrifying struggle to the tabletop.

The theme of personal horror goes beyond the game’s look and feel. The rules set has been crafted as a zombie survival game from the ground up, ensuring that each game has elements of drama, tension, and action that you have come to expect from the zombie genre.
168090.name: Dead Meat: Quarantine Zone America

168091.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 72 - Oct 2014)
168091.description:
Alternate Dungeons

From the publisher:

Dungeons, Only Different!

Everyone loves gathering friends for a good GURPS Dungeon Fantasy tomb-looting exploit. But sometimes you want to shake things up. Do things differently. Think "outside the dungeon." This issue of Pyramid -- the PDF magazine for roleplayers -- takes your Dungeon Fantasy game into unexpected realms.

This month's untraditional treasures include:


"Pointless Slaying and Looting," Dungeon Fantasy mastermind Sean Punch's guide to getting into the crypt-crawling game even faster by getting rid of character points. Design your heroes by picking from a few ready-made packages, and go go go!
"Dungeons of Mars," a meaty guide to bringing the action and excitement of dungeon fantasy to a whole new world, from Transhuman Space line editor Phil Masters. Discover how the tropes, themes, heroes, and threats of the Red Planet can come together for a different kind of Dungeon Fantasy experience.
"From the Bottom Up," a guide to playing as monsters in Dungeon Fantasy, from GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 8: Treasure Tables author Matt Riggsby! Use the included GURPS templates to become a dragon, lich, specter, and much more.
"Good Dungeons," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Banestorm: Abydos scribe David L. Pulver. Learn why the forces of good might dwell in dungeons . . . and why even ethical heroes might loot these dwellings.
"Dungeon Fantasy Video Gaming," a guide to bringing computer RPGs to the tabletop, with a versatile new GURPS template -- the imitator -- plus rules and guidelines for bringing the pixelated experience to the players.


This month's Pyramid wraps up with a Random Thought Table that gives you some ideas to make your own alternate dungeons. Whether you're looking for a new twist on traditional dungeoneering or something radically different, this issue is treasure beyond measure!

168092.description: The Time Traveller is a bonus hero that was first made available with the Eminent Domain: Microcosm kickstarter campaign. The Time Traveller has a pre-set party rather than rolling for companions at the start of a delve.
168092.name: Dungeon Roll Hero: Time Traveler

168093.name: Igby goes to an IT -job
168093.description:
Igby tries to get by as an IT specialist.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168094.name: Ghost Thief v 1.1
168094.description:
You walk aroung the earth while stealing stuff and finding collectibles. But your a ghost, so noone can see you do this. Explore a giant world, currently with

Source: The Publisher Website.

168095.name: Art of Relief
168095.description:
A game made out of the tutorial for quest. If you know where to look, it becomes hilarious.
This is my first game. Please review!

UPDATE 1 (Which came out one day after first release):
Added party city plot.
Added more jokes (can't ever have too many!).
Added the clothing function.
Fixed bugs.

UPDATE 2:
Completed Party City plot
Added Nancy plot
Fixed bugs (Squish, squish, squish)
Added even more jokes
Added reaction to monster mask

UPDATE 3 (Same day as UPDATE 2)
Squashed more bugs
Added boxing chamber

All similarities to objects living, dead, inanimate, male, male (named), male(plural), inanimate(plural), female, female(named), or female(plural) are purely coincidental.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168096.name: La Aventura de Parodi
168096.description:
You are Parodi who goes on the most epic adventure of his life, and yours...

Source: The Publisher Website.

168097.name: Arlan's Happy Birthday Adventure
168097.description:
This is a choose-your-own-adventure story about Arlan's Birthday.

Like many choose-your-own-adventures, the majority of the choices lead to death because there is only one option the author really wants you to get, so he makes the story end if you don't choose the one he wanted you too -- or because it was too much writing for the author to make every choice actually lead somewhere and he was too stupid to make there be fewer, but more meaningful choices.

Most likely, due the low-budget nature of most choose-your-own-adventures, there will be miss-linked paged, unfinished paths, and copiuos typos.

So you will embark, thinking the idea of a story where you can choose your path sounds cool, and finish irritated at having wasted your time on a storytelling gimmick that just doesn't work.

But its really funny and cool, trust me. Reviewers raved. Happy Birthday.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168098.name: The Prison
168098.description:
This is just a small bit of fun.
This enthralling journey follows the life of Snapdean, a simple nancy farmer, and the colourful characters he meets along the way.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168099.name: Skeleton Man [ALPHA- 1.1]
168099.description:
After an accident climbing a tree, nine year old Ethan Road is astounded to discover he is part man, part skeleton! Step into Ethan's shoes as a force for justice against leagues of would-be urban villains. With the power of your bone-structure, anything is possible.

ALL MUSIC BELONGS TO RESPECTIVE ARTISTS. i.e Kevin Macleod and CSI Miami soundtrack.

PLEASE SUPPORT THE OFFICAL RELEASES.


Warning, game is somewhat detatched for reality. X-Rays are not nearly as deadly as I make them out to be.*


Rating 12+

Source: The Publisher Website.

168100.name: An Adventure (the incomplete version)
168100.description:
This is an adventure. It will be fun. That's what adventures are. Fun. Right? Of course, if you're not risking your life with every little thing you do, it isn't fun!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168101.name: The Day that Everything Happened 2: Happen Harder
168101.description:
A sequel to the hit text-adventure game, now with the absolute insainity amped up to 12345678900987654321! You read a magazine about the events at Whatever Island and remember them. And then the agency who ordered you to go to Whatever Island has a new thing for ya.... Go to the Idontcare Desert, and examine a dimensional anomaly there! The circumstances are different, the protaganist is a person, the genre is different, and the stakes are higher!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168102.name: Jonathan's text based game
168102.description:
A fun, easy game with realistic narrative, this game is sure to be fun and make you not feel frustrated!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168103.name: The Day Everything Happened
168103.description:
A stupid little game I made, dedicated to Vinesauce and my friends I guess. I know this game is not good, and I know it's a little glitchy, but it's my first game. So yeah, although the main point of the game is to eat/smoke everything until you laugh your guts out, or I dunno, criticize it, I'll do a prologue.

"You are (Insert Name Here). You have traveled to the island of Nowhereville to find the final boss and defeat it. However, you have the magical ability to eat/smoke anything you want, so yeah. Go have fun."

Coming from Vinesauce? Oh, well I'll tell you something. Maybe an easter egg. Is it hidden in here? Considering the fact that i'm talking about it, maybe. Something about these sentences is odd. Any leads, please track them down. Never give up. Struggle to the very last fiber of your being. If you're confused by this, go watch Vinesauce right now. Zany stream, I tell you. Everyone needs to watch it.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168104.description:
The expansion to Monsters and Maidens includes a total of 4 black dice:


1 Adventure Die
1 Season Die
1 Tool Die
1 Fate Die
168104.name: Monsters and Maidens: Epic Dice

168105.name: KULT OK:KULT
168105.description:
user summary

German limited Faksimile-Version. Only 500 books were made.

this book combines
Kult (1st Edition)
OK·KULT

168106.description:
Promo card first issued at Essen 2014.

Discard: Buy this card for 1 less energy if signed by Richard Garfield.

+ 1 VP. When you buy this card challenge a Monster to Monster Chess. Bet an amount of energy you both can afford.

MONSTER CHESS: You both roll 3 dice as fast as you can. Keep your claws and reroll the others. First to get three claws wins all wagered energy.

This promo is "meant to be signed and handed out by Richard Garfield himself. It was a much smaller print, as you can imagine."
168106.name: King of New York: Washington Square Park

168107.description:
41 new cards for Hollywood unlocked with stretch goals of the Kickstarter project. Most of these cards are Kickstarter exclusive.

Contents:
PR Specialist (2), Lawyer (2), Method Acting Teacher (2), Singer (2), Gaffer (2), Dance Choreographer (2), Movie Critic (2), Actress / Director (2), Actor / Director (2), Actor / Actress (2), Director of Photography (1), Location Scout (1), Second Unit Director (6), Player aid cards (6), Movie Legend cards (7)
168107.name: Hollywood: Stretch Goal Cards

168109.name: Kit d'initiation
168109.description:
From the Introduction:

Bienvenue dans le kit de présentation du jeu de rôles "Anoë, l'Âge des Réofs". Dans ces quelques pages, nous nous efforcerons de vous présenter l'essentiel des attraits qu'offre la vie d'aventurier sur Alanaïs, la planète où se passeront vos aventures, ainsi que les avantages à utiliser le système de règles d'Anoë quand il s'agit de mener à bien sa mission.

Vous trouverez également en fin de ce kit un scénario prêt à jouer avec les personnages pré-tirés. Vous aurez alors tout ce qu'il faut pour vivre vos premières aventures en tant que Réof !

User Translation from the French:

Welcome to the introductory kit for the role-playing game "Anoë, l'Âge des Réofs". In these few pages, we will endeavour to present the key attractions that are offered by a life of adventure on Alanaïs, the planet where your adventures occur, and thus the advantages of using the Anoë's rules system when undertaking to complete one's mission.

You will also find at the end of this kit a ready-to-play scenario with pre-generated characters. And so you will have everything you need to play your first adventures as a Réof!

168111.name: Ardor
168111.description:
Have you ever wanted to build from scratch, fine tune and then live your most erotic, intimate and romantic desires?

Ardor is an unique strategy sex card game that enables you to do it.

Compete to collect cards which will be the building blocks for your fantasy.

Win the first part of the game to decide which fantasy will come true.

Mix and match the collected cards for an experience filled with Ardor!

Enhance the cards for activities to take a naughty twist which you control at all times. You have complete freedom on enhancing the cards and you can even level up each card differently every time you play the game for a highly customizable experience.

There are thousands of possible combinations allowing you to craft unique and unforgettable experiences!

Ardor has two parts:
Win Your Fantasy is a card game in which you win points and cards.
Live Your Fantasy Create your fantasy using what you've won to control all the details of what will happen next.

168112.name: Five Planets
168112.description:
Five Planets is a campaign and scenario pack for Quadrant 13 (Q13).
Five Planets contains twelve scenarios set within the Pankova solar system as two adversaries fight over its priceless resources. The action begins on Peach, the outermost planet, a most desolate, moon-like place but the gateway to the system, then moves through the asteroid belt that contains huge amounts of mineral wealth to Cheteria, the ice planet. After Cheteria comes Three, the garden world that feeds the system, followed by D'Var, the desert planet whose sands conceal vast seas of valuable oil. Finally the campaign climaxes on fiery Adeen, closest to the sun, but the source of limitless power.
The campaign is designed to be played through twice: with each player first taking the part of the race invading the Pankova system, the Attackers, and then taking the part of the incumbents, the Defenders. Be warned, sometimes the Defenders are attacking, and sometimes the Attackers are defending: as first one side then the other gains an advantage.
Although written for Q13, Five Planets can be easily adapted for any sci-fi rules system. Each scenario contains a full game briefing, a map, and then a briefing for each player, including a description of the forces available. All players need to do is print off the appropriate pages for the scenario that they want to play, set up the battlefield, break out the figures, and away they go. As the army lists given are generic, players can use them to play any sci-fi army that they choose: whether based on a particular range of figures, background from another ruleset, background from a film or book, or even a background that they have made up themselves.

168113.name: Olympus
168113.description:
user summary

A small promotional flyer by Pegasus Spiele from Germany. These Flyers were given to the gamers on many conventions in germany.

It contains one szenario for shadowrun 5, with a map of a conference center.

168114.name: Spielleiter Paket
168114.description:
user summary

A unique Gamemaster's Screen

this was a free bonus from Pegasus Spiele
given to people who purchased four Shadowrun (4th & Twentieth Anniversary Editions) core books

rpgissuearticle.131727: 1994-2014: venti anni anonimi, nel segno del cambiamento

168116.name: Jippijaja Quiz: Essen & Trinken
168116.description: 550 Questions about Food and Drinks from champagne to comfort food, party game

168117.name: À la discrétion du MJ
168117.description:
From the Back Cover:


"Omé, pousse-cailloux, tu veux savoir pourquoi je suis devenu Réof ? Simplement pour la gloire et l'honneur... J'déconne c'est surtout pour partir à l'aventure, j'aime l'action et les beaux combats. Rester avec une maman ork et mes charentaises devant un feu de bois en attendant que l'arthrose me rattrape, c'est pas mon truc..."


Anoë est un jeu de rôle où le médiéval-fantastique rencontre la science-fiction, et cela pour permettre de nombreuses ambiances : enquêtes urbaines, aventures épiques, tribulations pulps ou contes horrifiques... le tout dans un cadre cohérent.

Le système, à base de D10 sous compétence propose, entre autres, de gérer le stress des personnages et ses conséquences parfois inattendues, et aussi un système de magie libre et modulable.

Anoë, l'Âge des Réofs : Écran de jeu


De nouveaux Avantages, Recettes Alchimiques et Avantages pour créatures.
