La présentation des Objets Dééfiques, sorte d'objets magiques, accompagnées de leurs règles de créations.
Une nouvelle table de Coups Critiques qui différencie les armes tranchantes, perforantes, contondantes et divines.
Du matériel avec des véhicules, des balistes, des flèches et d'autres nouveautés.
Le journal des Réofs vous apportera des renseignements sur le monde.
Un scénario en trois actes, basé à Umbourg et ses alentours, et mettant en scène un sordide complot au sein de la noblesse...
Et pour finir ce livret, six nouveaux Archétypes.

rpgseries.26090: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System

168118.name: Save Game
168118.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE GLITCH HAS COME TO TENDORIA

A vicious computer virus threatens to corrupt the entire internet, and the only ones standing in its way are the characters from your video games.

8-bit heroes battle monsters and corrupted files—it's Wreck-It Ralph meets Lord of the Rings in a fight for the fate of the world!

This 56-page Fate Core adventure provides a complete world to adventure in, including randomized character generation rules, ideas to govern digital adventures, and new Fate point hacks.

PIXELS ARE FALLING. IT’S UP TO YOU TO SAVE GAME!

168119.name: Castes et Réofs
168119.description:
From the Introduction:

Les pages suivantes complètent et remplacent certaines pages du Livre de Base :

Le paragraphe "Total d'expérience" page 72.
Le chapitre "Les Castes" (notamment les salaires) pages 142 à 147.




Le supplément Gratuit "Code des Réofs" est également intégré à ce texte.

Le chapitre qui suit vous présente un résumé des castes.
Dans les pages suivantes nous détaillerons : Les Réofs, les Birnums et les Arrangeurs, castes importantes pour ce jeu.

User Translation from the French:

The following pages supplement and replace certain pages from the core rulebok:

The paragraph "Total Experience" on page 72.
The chapter "The Castes" (including salaries) pages 142 to 147.




The free supplement "Code des Réofs" is also integrated in this text.

The next chapter presents a summary of the castes.
In the following pages we will detail: the Réofs, the Birnums and the Arrangers, important castes for this game.

168120.name: The Sun Below: City on the Edge
168120.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if I told you there is a world below this one? A world with its own sun? Full of strange peoples, amazing discoveries, and unspeakable horror? Finding your way down to this world is almost impossible.

Finding a way back up, well, that’s worse.

The Sun Below: City on the Edge, an epic adventure for Numenera that takes place deep below the surface of the Ninth World. What starts as an investigation into the aftermath of the Iron Wind soon turns to kiddnapping, a strange journey to an even stranger city.

Who will the player characters trust? Will they escape The City on the Edge?

An adventure for any tier party that your players will never forget.

168121.description:
This expasion consists of 3 tiles:

Darmstadtium (the place where Darmstadt Spielt takes place since 2010): to be placed inside a city. The winner of this city gains 3 extra points
Kirche St. Ludwig (Church of St. Ludwig): to be played like a cloister. The player with the most meeples on the church and the 8 tiles surrounding it gains 3 extra points
Russische Kapelle (Russian Chapel): same as the Church of St. Ludwig




It is part of a die-cut sheet, 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt. To mark his 20th anniversary the play group "Spielekreis Darmstadt" published a die-cut sheet with mini expansions to five popular games:

• Carcassonne
• Hugo, das Schlossgespenst (aka: Midnight Party)
• Die Siedler von Catan (aka: The Settlers of Catan)
• Village Port
• Zooloretto

The die-cut sheet was sold during the event "Darmstadt plays" from Nov. 15 through 16, 2014 and before that at the fair "Spiel" in Essen from Oct. 16 through 19, 2014 at the magazine "Spielerei". It can still (June 2015) be ordered via the homepage. Part of the Carcassonne series.
168121.name: Carcassonne: Darmstadt

168122.description:
This is a new treasure chest that is added to the chests of the Village Port expansion.

It is part of a die-cut sheet, 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt. To mark his 20th anniversary the play group "Spielekreis Darmstadt" published a die-cut sheet with mini expansions to five popular games:

• Carcassonne
• Hugo, das Schlossgespenst (aka: Midnight Party)
• Die Siedler von Catan (aka: The Settlers of Catan)
• Village Port
• Zooloretto

The die-cut sheet was sold during the event "Darmstadt plays" from Nov. 15 through 16, 2014 and before that at the fair "Spiel" in Essen from Oct. 16 through 19, 2014 at the magazine "Spielerei".
168122.name: Village Port: Schatzkiste

168124.name: The Snollygoster (Volume 1, Number 1 - Sep 2013)
168124.description:
From introduction:

Welcome to the first issue of The Snollygoster, an infrequent newsletter of ideas and alternates for the Tunnels & Trolls role playing game created by Ken St. Andre and published by Flying Buffalo Incorporated. This publication is completely contributor driven and all contents are copyright to the respective authors.

168125.name: Holtgrimm's Cataloque of Hallow'een Hokum
168125.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come one, come all to Holtgrimm's Catalogue of Hallow'een Hokum!

A game system generic source book of Hallow'een delights!

We have:

Superstitions!
Items of Hallowe’en Safety!
Things that go bump in the Night(among other places)!




All for use with your current favorite RPG

(and some stats for a few of ours too)!

168127.name: Evermore
168127.description:
What began as a celebration ended in tragedy when a wizard's fiery display went awry. Now, through no fault of your own, you find yourself trapped in a time loop forced to live the same day over and over and over and over again. Your only hope lies in a wizard whose advertisement you stumbled across in your search for answers and knowledge. He has informed you that he can cast a spell, tailor made for just you, that can open a portal through space and time.

For the first time in a very long while there is a faint glimmer of hope on the horizon. All you have to do is figure out a way to locate the spell components that the wizard needs and manage your day efficiently so that you can gather them all in time...

Evermore is a card auction, set collection, dice rolling game in which 2 - 4 players will compete to gain the knowledge necessary to efficiently gather the required components to win the game.

168128.name: Insignia of Bromide the Wicked
168128.description:
From publisher blurb:

In your many adventures since ridding the world of Sukits the Butcher you have heard whisperings of his boss in the area. The name Bromide the Wicked has been passed around as a greater threat to the freedom in the area as he is the slaver boss. The Plainsmen have given your party the general direction of this evil man and ask for your help in the matter. Is your party ready to deal with the slaver issue and take down the network of traffickers?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a group of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

168129.name: Lejends Magazine (Volume 1, Issue 2 - Jun 2001)
168129.description:
From the cover:

Within the Scroll:

Xagig's Fables
NAC Contacts

The Watchers Way
Stone Tools

The Star Chamber
Game Styles

The Adept's Vault

168130.name: Lejends Magazine (Volume 1, Issue 3 - Jul 2001)
168130.description:
From the Cover:

Within the Scroll:

Xagig's Fables
Managing Mass Combat

Laws of the Realms
Spelling Counts!

The Star Chamber
Unarmed Combat

Out of the Wilderness

168131.name: Vistula-Oder-Berlin: the campaign in Poland and East Germany, 1945
168131.description:
Vistula-Oder-Berlin: the campaign in Poland and East Germany, 1945 is a simulation for two or more players that simulate the campaign of 1945 in Poland and Eastern Germany from January to May 1945.

Each hex on the map represents approximately 20km. Axis units are divisions and brigades, Allied units are Army Corps. Each game turn represents two weeks of real time. Two scenarios: campaign (Deutschland Kaputt! January-May, from the Vistula-Oder operation to the fall of Berlin and Prague) and Der Katastrophe (January-March 1945).

The game system is similar to that used in Hongrie 1944-1945 (Vae Victis #78, Command Japan #100).

168132.name: The Snollygoster (Volume 1, Number 2 - Dec 2013)
168132.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the Longest Night Edition of The Snollygoster, an infrequent newsletter of ideas and alternates for the Tunnels & Trolls role playing game created by Ken St. Andre and published by Flying Buffalo Incorporated. This publication is completely contributor driven and all contents are copyright to the respective authors.

Longest Night is one of the greatest festivals for the Trolls of Trollhalla. It's the Winter Solstice and literally the longest night of the year. Some trolls have been know to stay up late that night, congregate on Trollhalla.com and drink. You
know who you are.

168133.name: The Snollygoster (Volume 1, Number 3 - Mar 2014)
168133.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the third issue of The Snollygoster, an infrequent newsletter of ideas and alternates for the Tunnels & Trolls role
playing game created by Ken St. Andre and published by Flying Buffalo Incorporated. This publication is completely contributor driven and all contents are copyright to the respective authors.

168134.description:
The players are pilgrims that get lost in an old enchanted forest. In order to find the exit they have to collect the magical items watched by Meiga, Moura and Lobishome in their dwellings, but...be careful! one of the players is the Santa Compaña, who disguised like a pilgrim try to undermine its playmates' pursuit and turn them one by one in its allies.

Every player has a Character card that shows if it is a Pilgrim or the Santa Compaña. He can't show it to the other players. Each player will use Pathway cards to move around the board choosing every turn what card have to play (they can be steps, bridge or do not move). Every Pilgrim has to look for two item cards shown in his Character card. The item cards are kept in the creature dwellings. In order to gain these cards the Pilgrim has to pay life tokens to the keepers.
In the meantime the Santa Compaña player, secretly, will use its cards to threaten the other players, steal their life tokens and finally convert them to its allies. The only way for the Pilgrims to save themselves is to discover who is the Santa Compaña, use defensive item cards to repel it or finally find the requested cards to open the magical door and escape, reaching Santiago de Compostela.

Peregrinus is a dynamic and amusing game where luck, teamwork, intuition and strategy are equally necessary in order to discover dangers, find out the correct magical items, leave the enchanted forest before being caught by the Santa Compaña and reach Santiago. So, dare to enter the forest?
168134.name: Peregrinus: Santiago de Compostela

168135.name: The Snollygoster (Volume 1, Number 4 - Oct 2014)

rpgissuearticle.131853: Alternate Death Paragraphs for Solo Adventures

168135.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the fourth issue of The Snollygoster, an infrequent newsletter of ideas and alternates for the Tunnels & Trolls role
playing game created by Ken St. Andre and published by Flying Buffalo Incorporated. This publication is completely contributor driven and all contents are copyright to the respective authors. Thanks to Jeff Freels for the illustration and clip art!

168136.name: Codex Nordica
168136.description:
Publishers Blurb:

With iron grips, they held their ships at sea. Face to the wind, back to the mist, they cut the water in their dragon prow ships, bringing the song of death and plunder upon the backs of gods that rose from the maelstrom of eternity. With axe and sword, shield and spear, they rose as if from the ether and opened the world to a storm of primeval lust.

The Codex Nordica plunges into their world, exploring the myths and cultures of the Vikings, from Odin's Ravens to the Jotun fortress of Gymirsheim. Brian Young explores the Nine Worlds of the northmen, the legends and myths, the magical creatures, gods, heroes, giants and monsters that peopled them.

All this is presented as a backdrop to the game you are already playing. Expanding upon the core Castles & Crusades material Codex Nordica brings a host of new wizardry and enchantments, gods for the characters, warriors and battle craft. Added on to all this, are new materials for the Castle Keeper, all designed to enhance rather than hinder play.

Codex Nordica brings the Viking myths to life at the table!

168137.name: Class Warfare
168137.description:
Publisher Blurb:
What is Class Warfare?
Class Warfare is a rules supplement for the Dungeon World role-playing game that provides an alternate and expanded system of character creation. It can also be used to create new character classes, just like those provided in the original rulebook. How Class Warfare does this is by breaking down the Dungeon World character class into smaller pieces—like specialties and archetypes—and showing you how they fit together.

168138.name: The Vordis Scourge, Volume II
168138.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Terrifying Merger of Cold Steel and Undead Flesh!

The vordis are a group of construct-like creatures that are part machine and part undead, preserved flesh. The vordis come in many shapes and sizes, and indeed, they are in many ways more of a culture or an organization than they are a race. Their numbers grow by harvesting the flesh of living creatures, which they incorporate into ever more strange and exotic designs The ultimate goal of the vordis is nothing less than to recreate all life in their own twisted, metallic image.

This book presents both mythic and non-mythic versions of two members of this terrifying race. The vordis surgeon (CRs 9 and 11) is not only the horrifying product of mad science, but is devoted to performing the same kinds of twisted and sadistic experiments that created it on other creatures. Its surgical claws slice and dice with horrifying ease, and its special serums can transform the living into the undead, or allow it to control undead already animated. The vordis harvester (CRs 12 and 15) has the upper-body of a humanoid corpse, and the lower body of a massive cockroach. It can remove its victims’ limbs with its attacks, and then quickly graft those limbs onto its own body in order to gain a variety of benefits from them. Beyond these four monster stat-blocks, the book also contains a graft from each of these two types of vordis monstrosities, allowing players who harvest these parts to attach them to themselves in order to use the vordis’s greatest weapons against them.

168139.name: Ziggurat

videogamehonor.37571: 2014 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Winner

168139.description:
As a neophyte sorcerer you are one of many to go the rite of passage: to enter the maze of the Ziggurat and face deadly skulls, skeletons, ghosts and powerful bosses in order to clear your way through the final floor equipped with powerful wands, staffs or spell books. Only through this, you will become a powerful wizard.

Ziggurat is a Rogue-Lite Dungeon Crawl FPS (First person shooter) in which you go through procedurally generated dungeons, floor by floor, room by room to find perks and more powerful spells to become stronger with each playthrough.

As a Rogue-Lite Game it works within the permadeath system - meaning when you are dead, you have to start over from the beginning. But as you play, you will find many powerful unlockables to become stronger everytime. Only to someday make it to the top of the Ziggurat.

Rooms will be filled with Monsters, Traps or both. Many rooms change the games rules, such as throwing invisible enemies at you or decrease your run speed for an extra challenge. You can find many secret rooms and treasures, provided you are vigilant enough.

At the end of each floor a powerful boss Monster awaits you, while standing between you and the portal to the next floor.

Source: The Developer Website.

168140.name: Augen auf im Straßenverkehr!
168140.description: The players have to shop in 6 different Stores. The first player to gather 6 different Merchandise Cards, winns the game. The players may choose to move from shop to shop as a pedestrian or with a car or a bicycle, while observing the traffic rules. The other players can be impeded by playing a Traffic Card to close off a street or activate a traffic sign.

168141.description:
An all-dice game where players build towers and hire waves of monsters to send against their opponents.

Towers and monsters are both represented by dice. In the first phase of each round, players spend resources to construct towers, cast spells and hire a variety of monsters. In the second phase, players send hired monsters against their opponents. A wave of monster dice is rolled, and the values on the dice are compared to the strength of the tower being attacked. Each monster has a chance to activate special abilities to assist in the attack.

Each monster who passes all opposing towers has a chance to score victory points.
168141.name: Epic Dice Tower Defense

168143.name: The Hidden Stash of Sweets
168143.description:
You live in a house and 10 years ago your mum hid a giant stash of sweets but unfortunately your mum died 3 years ago and no one knew where the sweets were.One day you ran out of food and money but you had water and your dad told you there were hidden sweets.you have to help find the sweets with the 3 children and the dad but where will it be. There will be a witch around to ruin your journey so be careful. you have to find scrolls to complete you journey.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168144.name: You are Garrosh Hellscream for one day
168144.description:
you are garrosh hellscream for one day. You must escape to draenor!
ps this game breaks the fourth wall...A LOT. Please do mind that.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168145.name: Your Fort is So Awesome
168145.description:
You are building the sweetest fort of your young life, and it is nearly finished. A text adventure.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168146.name: The Quest for the Cookie
168146.description:
Oh hello player. My, you look bored. Why don't you go on a quest? Yes player, a quest. Look at your face. You think I'm crazy. Hah. How funny. But deep inside, you want to go on a adventure. You know you want to. A gamebook choose your own adventure game with multiple endings. This is my first game. Once I get the hang of things, i'll make longer, improved games.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168147.name: One Night on the Internet
168147.description:
This is a great way to look at how we spend a night on the Internet. Sounds boring? Well, there's many funny twists!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168148.name: To Follow or Not to Follow
168148.description:
Will you listen to the narrator? Or will you choose your own path? Either way, try not to be misled and deceived as you attempt to make your way to the end of the game. Note, there are multiple endings, so be sure to play the game multiple times to see them all!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168149.name: Go To School
168149.description:
You have to go to school, but... Wait... Ooh, shiny!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168150.name: I Need to get this Paper
168150.description:
Another weird comedy from Moosepotato. Actually considered funny by Slug Life creator Dangerneck. If you don' t know him, you don't have a life, sorry.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168151.name: Sasha The AK
168151.description:
Will you survive the Zombie Apocalypse with your trusty AK?

Source: The Publisher Website.

168152.name: Ty - Logic of Infinity
168152.description:
Ty has been making games for over four years and now his computer is susceptible to a virus known as R3@L. Ever since the evil force of R3@L has infected the website, Ty has been warped to a universe inside his incomplete game. Now it is up to you, Mathew the Engineer, to destroy the virus and save TextAdventures. Good luck.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168153.name: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice
168153.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game is announced but has not been released yet and is NOT sold yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




The story is based on Celtic myth and focuses on Senua, Hellblade’s protagonist as she embarks on a very personal journey through a hellish underworld.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hellblade", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

168154.name: Casualties of the Cursed Wood
168154.description:
user summary

An adventure module made exclusively for the Haunted Highlands Kickstarter that funded July 24th, 2013.

It was released as an exclusive release for the campaign for a stretch reward ($10,000 stretch goal).

Adventure Designed for 2 - 6 characters of 6 ~ 9 level with a challenge rating of 7. It can easily be scaled up or down as needed.

from page 2 of the module

"The characters experience a longish adventure where they are introduced to many different types of gunpowder weapons. The characters are hired to lead a wagon train blessed by Tevnut the goddess of nature, the earth and fresh waters. The trip begins in Mantua, proceeds down through the Northern Steppes and into Mafurrow, and over to Lake Ugashtan. While the group thinks their last stop is the Crater of Umeshti, they are wrong. One of the primary sources of evil in the lad is the Tower of the Necromancer in the Cursed Woods. The characters are urged by the priestesses to take on the challenge of the Necromancer's Tower."

168155.name: Adjugé vendu
168155.description:
The objective of Adjugé vendu is to become the richest art collector before the close of the auction!

Players seek out the most unusual and rare paintings, buy, sell and collect them, participating on auctions but must be careful because some items are copies!

The game also has electronic detector for detecting the false paintings!

If there are not paintings left the player with the most money is the winner.

168157.name: Greedy Billionaire and the College Student
168157.description:
This is a card game where players are College Students trying to graduate before the Greedy Billionaire can take away all their money. They start with a supply of money and will need to pay tuition and other expenses each year (round). They score points for graduating and for avoiding bankruptcy. The Greedy Billionaire is not an actual player but he scores points for each College Student that goes bankrupt.

Players graduate by playing 4 Pass Exam cards (one each for freshman, sophomore, junior and senior year) and one Graduation card. In order to obtain enough money to pay tuition, players may play action cards to get a job, earn a scholarship and receive financial aid. But beware! Their opponents will play Greedy Billionaire Cards to send their job overseas, raise tuition, cut the education budget, pollute the earth, and accuse them of cheating.

Points are tallied at the end of each hand and the final object is to be the first player to score 150 points in several hands of play.

168160.name: The Dragons of Britain (Issue 4 - Autumn 2014)
168160.description: User Summary: 'The Dragons of Britain' is a free e-zine dedicated to roleplaying in Arthurian Britain. It features articles, adventures, adventure seeds, and more for King Arthur Pendragon & Age of Arthur.

168161.name: Dungeon Lord (Issue 1 - Oct 2014)
168161.description:
Dungeon Lord
Issue #1
October 2014

Cover art by Jason Michael Manson.

168162.name: Kingdom Wars
168162.description:
User Summary

This MMO promises that money spent on the game are for cosmetic purposes and not to give any advantage in gameplay. Its specialty is siege combat and lush 3D visuals.

168163.name: Stranger Danger
168163.description:
Stranger Danger is a card game for daring people in public places. Challenge your friends to approach a person in the crowd and discover what strangers will do to help you win.

On your turn, draw Stranger cards to describe a person to perform a challenge with. Then select from the Challenge cards you are given by the players on either side of you. To earn points, predict how the stranger will answer a Question or convince them to perform a Request.

168165.name: Switch: The Game of Ups and Downs
168165.description:
Switch is the exciting game in which three to five players race to play cards in sequence. But watch out! Letters and numbers can go up, down, or stay the same... and switch at any time. Be the first player out of cards and win!

Switch (the predecessor to Qwitch) consists of a deck of 64 cards, each containing one of eight numbers (1–8) and one of eight letters (A–H), and a die with plus, minus, and equals symbols. After hands are dealt, one player turns a card from the deck face up and rolls the die. Players race to play the next card from their hands, determined by the symbol on the die.

168166.description:
The game is played with 12 treasure tiles and a six-sided die. The front of the tiles show various treasures: crown, genie lamp, or goblet. Each tile has one, two, or three treasures of the same type. To start the game, all twelve tiles are placed face down in the playing area.

Three faces of the die show a crown, lamp, and goblet; the other three show the numbers one, two, and three. Players take turns rolling the die, then must turn over a tile with either the same type of treasure (if a treasure was rolled) or the matching number of treasures (if a number was rolled). If the treasure matches, the player keeps it and places it face down in front of her.

Instead of turning over a tile in the center of the playing area, the active player may turn over a tile belonging to an opponent. If the tile matches, the player may steal it and take it into her own area.
168166.name: Her mit dem Schatz!

168167.description:
Fatal Choices: Wargames, Decisions and Destiny in the 1914 Battles of Coronel and Falklands is an experimental history using authentic naval wargames to examine choices made in the World War I battles of Coronel and Falklands

“And now began the saddest naval action of the war (Coronel). Of the officers and men in both the squadrons that faced each other in these stormy seas far from home, nine of ten were doomed to perish.”

-- Winston Churchill

This autumn marks the centennial of The Great War. Among the most dramatic sagas in a dramatic season was that of the German East Asia Squadron under Rear Adm. Maximilian Graf von Spee. Stranded by the sudden outbreak of war on the other side of the world, Spee’s squadron evaded enemy forces for months. Dispatched the raider Emden to harry British trade in the Indian Ocean and then handed the Royal Navy its first defeat in battle in 99 years off the shore of Chile near Cape Coronel. That devastating defeat sent two British armored cruisers to the depths with their entire crews at trifling cost to Spee’s squadron.

The stunning defeat provoked the British into sending two of their new battlecruisers thousands of miles from the European theater to search for and destroy Spee’s squadron. Spee and the British squadron met at The Falklands just five weeks after Coronel. This time it was Spee’s squadron which was annihilated.

For a hundred years historians and naval officers have debated Spee’s choices and those of his opponents and speculated about what might have been. Fatal Choices looks at the course of the actual campaign and considers how it might have played out differently. But more than that, Fatal Choices applies the discipline of authentic naval wargames to evaluate those what-ifs under realistic constraints. And it provides the reader with the tools to see for himself how the battles may have played out.

By special arrangement with noted author and wargame designer Larry Bond, Fatal Choices contains an extract of Bond’s superbly authentic and comprehensive Fear God & Dread Nought naval wargaming rules providing the reader with all the rules, ship forms and tables needed to refight the historical battles and several credible what-ifs. See For Yourself scenarios examine historical battles such as Coronel and the Cocos Islands, as well as possible alternative fights such as Spee running into the Australian battlecruiser HMAS Australia or the old battleship HMS Canopus. Other scenarios examine what might have happened if the modern armored cruiser HMS Defence had joined the British squadron in time for Coronel or if Spee had a ventured to attack the British ships while they were coaling in Stanley Harbor instead of attempting to flee.

Fatal Choices also includes another entire set of rules, an extract of Minden Game’s NavTac fast-play naval wargaming rules for those readers who are new to naval wargaming or pressed for time.

The Kickstarter edition of Fatal Choices also includes a special set of laser-cut ship counters including all the ships mentioned in the scenarios as well as play aids.
168167.name: Fatal Choices

168168.description: The game is played with two sets of cards, one set showing the top half of a ballerina figure in various positions, and the other showing the bottom half. The first player turns over one card of each type forming a complete picture of a ballerina and must imitate the position shown. On subsequent turns, each player must imitate the previous position from memory and then reveal a new one. The players win if they successfully complete the "ballet".
168168.name: Prima Ballerina

168169.name: Dark Druids (Pathfinder)
168169.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the Woods are Wild and Wicked, Beware!

Druids have long been an afterthought in RPGs, relegated to the sidelines of adventure as harmless hermits or tree-hugging environmentalists. NO LONGER! Though little noticed, evil alignments have been open to druids since the dawn of 3rd Edition, and in a wilderness-based campaign they make magnificent and malevolent menaces. This product discusses the role of druids as villains and introduces the concept of the Umbral Wood, a transplanar wilderness that reaches across the Shadow Plane, the Fey Realms, and into the Material Plane. Deep in the heart of this blackest forest lies the realm of the Midnight Master, a debauched and debased deity that embodies every awful possibility that might darken the heart of a corrupted warden of the wilderness. What follows is a collection of archetypes, richly detailed and thematic feats, and druid spells. With over 30 new rules elements, including spells like bloodspear, drought, and nightwing host and feats like Tidalwave of Rot and Unhallowed Shade of the Umbral Wood, alongside the Darkwolf and Unseelie Ovate druid archetypes, this 26-page sourcebook offers a bevy of options for making your druids dangerous and deadly!

168170.name: Road to Destiny (5E)
168170.description:
From publisher blurb:

A stunning sandbox adventure for 2nd-level characters!

A legacy of death bears bitter fruit in the northern coastlands, as brothers long separated rise to the call of their darkling heritage. A new destiny has arisen in the west that threatens to shake the foundations of an empire half a world away, but not if Ranulfr the White Wolf and his one-eyed sibling can waylay these would-be heroes on their road to destiny! Bandits hound their steps, driving them from danger to danger, until their road reaches its bitter and bloody end - for them or their enemies!

Road to Destiny is a 36-page sandbox adventure for 2nd-level characters using the 5th edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game. It delivers clever combats, negotiation and investigation, a delightful mix of urban and wilderness adventure possibilities, and roleplaying possibilities aplenty. The adventure can be played on its own as a self-contained campaign adventure or as part of an epic Adventure Path campaign that journeys from the northern coastlands to the Far East.

168171.name: The Pumpkin Field
168171.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Gather round, you young'uns - and let me tell you why you should never go the The Pumpkin Field..."

The Pumpkin Field is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Pumpkin Field is a day & night set, comprising 2 battlemaps. The map consists of a series of large pumpkin fields, with a paved road on one side, and a small copse of trees. Mist covers the area, and there are numerous small things to look out for - a fresh grave, a lost sword, a fallen scarecrow - and at night some of the pumpkins have a life of their own.

The Pumpkin Field is ideal for countless adventures. If you're planning a Halloween or Horror story, with Headless Horsemen, Sleepy Hollow-esque murder and horror, the map is ideal. It can be used for any other encounters too - robbery by highway bandits, ambushed by goblins, or helping the ghosts of murdered travellers.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

168172.name: Official Sergal Racial Guide
168172.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Official Sergal Racial Guide

The famous anthropomorphic race created by Mick39 and Kiki-UMA from the world of Vilous comes to Pathfinder!

(If you are not familar with sergals or Vilous. check out this wiki!)

This is a product officially endorced by Mick39 and Kiki-UMA (AKA the parallel bird friends)

168173.name: Amnesia
168173.description:
Help, I don’t know who I am!

Amnesia is the fun new card game of lost identities and wacky faces. Players use a mix of memory and deduction to rediscover their identities. The first player to do so is the winner!


Gameplay Overview

Players each hold 4-5 cards in their hand. However, 1 of these cards is only visible to their opponents. The aim of the game is to successfully guess your hidden card (1 of 16 characters).

On their turn, players may ask any 1 opponent how many cards they hold of a particular type (hair colour or face type). Players must answer truthfully and out loud for everyone to hear. As information comes out, players can begin to deduce which character they are (or are not).

Once a player thinks they know which character they are, they can make a guess. If they are correct, they win! If they are wrong, they are knocked out of the game.

168174.description:
Dinos have been spotted in the jungle! You make hasty tracks after them to experience this excitement with your own eyes. But it‘s not very easy to catch sight of these massive ancient creatures. Whoever manages to uncover the sought after dinos and reach the end of the dinosaur footprint path first wins the game.

Each player takes a wooden dinosaur token and places it at the start of a four-tile track. Five dinosaur tiles are shuffled and placed face down in a row on the table. Then in turn, players turn over one of 26 search tiles. If the search tile shows a "trade symbol," the player exchanges two dinosaur tiles without looking at them. If the search tile shows a picture of two or three dinosaurs, the player must turn over an equivalent number of dinosaur tiles. If they match exactly, that player's dinosaur advances on the track. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

In the "expert" variant, a sixth, blank tile is shuffled in along with the five dinosaur tiles.
168174.name: On the Hunt for Dinos

168175.name: Eier im Anflug
168175.description: Players take turns catapulting egg tiles onto a grid of rabbit tiles. If an egg misses the rabbits, it stays on the table where it landed. If it lands on a rabbit tile, then the player gets to keep the egg along with all eggs of the same color still on the table. The game ends when all 30 eggs have been catapulted, and the player with the most eggs wins.

168176.description: Twelve chair tiles and twelve guest tiles are placed face-down on the table. On her turn, a player selects one chair tile and one guest tile. If they match, the player scores one point. Otherwise they are returned face-down to the table. When all of the guests are seated, the player who scored the most points wins.
168176.name: Hipp hipp hurra!

168177.name: Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN-

videogamehonor.31977: 2014 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

168177.description:
Continuing the style of frantic fighting action from previous games, the game is now presented in cel-shaded graphics, which use limited animation to replicate the feel of 2D sprites whilst allowing for more dynamic camera movement. The game is set in 2187, one year after its predecessor, Guilty Gear 2: Overture.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guilty Gear Xrd", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

168178.name: A Camp in the Woods
168178.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

The story begins with you and your girlfriend finding your way to an abandoned house in a village after a shipwreck.

168179.name: Volchaos
168179.description:
Volchaos is an ultra-challenging old school platformer. As a nameless explorer, you must navigate through dangerous volcanoes in search of precious gems you can use to pay off your mortgage, bad investments, and alimony. To further complicate matters, the lava is continuously rising and an array of enemies stands in your path. Will you become rich? Heck, you will be lucky to survive.

Game Features You Will Love

42 levels (plus challenging expert level variations)
Online leaderboards for fastest level times (PC Only)
Level editor (PC Only)
Super retro graphic emulation!




Source: The Developer Website.

168180.name: An Imp? A Fiend
168180.description:
Stuck in the Underworld without the slightest clue why, a young fiend has a bit of a mystery to solve in this action/adventure platformer. With a world to explore, a past to uncover, and quite the task to complete, players must embark on a quest filled with monsters, towns, dungeons, bosses, and various platforming challenges.

Features


Several rooms with various platforming challenges and monsters
Explore towns, raid dungeons, and defeat the bosses hidden within
Uncover the past of the young fiend and find his purpose in the Underworld
Supports Xbox 360 Controller




Source: The Developer Website.

168181.name: HassleHeart

videogamehonor.37572: 2014 AzPlay Awards Best Basque Game Winner

168181.description:
HassleHeart is an amazing arcade game where you are a heartless robot, living on a cheap battery that’s running out fast.You need humans hearts to extend your live and you’re going to have to kill for it.

Source: The Developer Website.

168182.name: LocaliZED
168182.description:
Did you ever feel like your town was a dead end full of mindless drones? Like you just had to get out of there at any cost? Well now you might be right! LocaliZED is a Zombie survival game set in your backyard. It is a 1-8 player co-op game that uses any map and your imagination to turn your neighbourhood in into Zombified blood fest.

LocaliZEd is an open-source print and play game that encourages players to customise their game within the parameters of the core rule set. LocaliZED has players use a map of their hometown, or anywhere else they would like to try and survive a Zombie apocalypse, as the board. On this board a few key locations, church, school, police station are set and then players are given missions at random that force them to interact with these locations while Zombies quickly accumulate on the board.

As the game progresses players draw cards from one common deck that sometimes cause more Zombies to flood the map, sometimes giving the players bonus items and sometimes changing the dynamic of the whole board.
The game is turn based and the turn sequence runs like this: clockwise players may all move once. Then running clock-wise again, from the same starting player, each player must fight the Zombies in their location once only.
The core mechanic that players use to combat Zombies is really simple. In a location that has Zombies players must roll a D6. If they roll a score greater than the number of Zombies they are fighting then they have won the combat. They may now remove Zombies equal to the difference between their score and the number of Zombies. If they roll a score equal to the number of Zombies this is a draw and nothing happens. If they roll less than the number of Zombies then they have lost the combat and they lose 1 life.
A roll of a 1 on any dice at any time means they lose the combat. A roll of a 6 on any dice at any time means they may roll an extra dice and count its result towards their score.
For instance, if there are 4 Zombies in a location and you roll a 5 then you may remove 1 Zombie, because 5 is one greater than 4. If you had rolled a 4 then you would have drawn the combat and nothing would happen. If you had rolled a 6 you may have re-rolled the dice and added the score of the second dice to the original 6 potentially rolling another 6 and gaining yet another re-roll. If you had rolled a 3, 2 or 1 then you would have lost and had to lose 1 life.
Players may team-up to fight Zombies, and this becomes very necessary. To do this they must be in the same Location. All players who are teaming-up must agree to the team-up before any dice are rolled. The player who’s fighting (because it is their turn) may now roll their dice once only using their weapons. Then they may roll an extra dice for each other player that teamed-up. The player adds the totals together and combats the Zombies with this score. Teaming-up allows players to achieve much higher scores. However, the down side of teaming up is that if they lose the combat everyone in the team-up loses 1 life.

LocaliZED also contains a rather unique mechanic for death. There is no player elimination, instead the dead player switches sides becoming a Zombie and gaining some control of the normally random Zombie deployment.

All of these missions and combat are driving the game towards the Final Mission. This one of 5 set endings for the game that can only be revealed once players have burned through all of the other missions. Final mission are always much harder than the individual missions that lead up to them but they generally involve all of the players working together to achieve them. Final missions range from hiding till the end of the apocalypse, curing the Zombies, killing the other players, or just out right killing all of the Zombies.
The tone of the game is quite tongue in cheek with a lot of the missions and cards having humorous elements. Every part of the game is designed to leave the door wide open for players really take ownership of the scenarios an in-game elements, with blank cards of every type being provided, the onus being on using your own map as a board.

The game was written in response to the Beasts of War websites 2014 Halloween game design challenge. Beasts of War then went on to distribute the game as free down load to all of their members.

168183.name: Farm Machines: Championships 2014
168183.description:
The ultimate farmers' showdown returns with monstrous new machines, brand new events and an expansive new terrain!

Are you the fastest, most accurate and craziest farmer in the competition?

Climb aboard Farm Machines Championship 2014 and sit behind the wheel of tenacious tractors and humongous harvesters to compete in 40 various events. Test your skills in new events, such as racing with forage wagons or transporting grain. Tune up your machines by changing the gearbox, engine or brakes. And change your tractor's look by adding additional elements to its chassis to distinguish you from the rest of contenders including fresh paint, decals, pipes and more.

Farm Machines Championships 2014 includes:


11 dynamic racing events
12 brand new farm machines and equipment
robust and challenging gameplay
giant new map depicting various landscapes, plants, and architecture


Source: The Developer Website.

168184.name: Von Hügelgrab und Dampfhammer
168184.description:
user summary

This adventure book contains two adventures which have been previously published as PDF on the web. It includes an adapted version of the famous Midgard adventure Das Hügelgrab bei Caetherlach (The hillside grave at Caetherlach) calles Das Hügelgrab bei Reynoldston (The hillside grave at Reynoldston). The second adventure is a steampunk adventure called Der Dampfhammer (The steam hammer).

168185.name: Moravod
168185.description:
user summary

A map of the country of Moravod set on the world of Midgard.

168186.name: Iggrgard
168186.description:
user summary

A map of the city of Iggrgard, the capital of Waeland set on the world of Midgard.

168187.name: The Maker's Eden
168187.description:
The Maker's Eden is a first-person point and click adventure game presented in the style of a motion comic. All scenes are meticulously hand-painted, but uses camera and perspective tricks to create depth and an enhanced sense of "being there".

The setting is retro-futuristic with a few noir tropes thrown in, and a mystery for you to unravel.

Source: The Developer Website.

168188.name: World Truck Racing
168188.description:
Racing trucks accelerate to 100 km/h faster than most supercars.

Now you can feel the power of their twelve-cyllinder engines firsthand. Get behind the wheel of these road monsters and take part in a worldwide series of races.

Be on your guard, because truck racing is a close-contact sport and your opponents will do everything to eliminate you from the race.

Changing weather conditions and time of day also won't help you. You will need to demonstrate your extraordinary driving skills and correctly choose the settings of your car to get the championship title.


12 trucks
16 racetracks
Mechanical and visual tuning
4 race modes


Source: The Publisher Website.

168189.name: Die Sturminseln
168189.description:
user summary

A map of storm islands on the world of Midgard. The storm islands are a not official version of the central Islands of the Pfortenarchipel (Gateway archipel) at the southern end of Midgards central ocean Meer der fünf Winde (Sea of five winds).

user comment
purchased at Essen 2014
no artist, year or product code

168190.name: Les Œufs de Karlatt
168190.description:
From the back
Trois aventures meurtrières très détaillées et conçues par un joueur français.

Translation
Three very detailed, murderous adventures, designed by a French player.

168192.name: La Cité des treize plaisirs
168192.description:
user summary

This booklet includes several adventures, the description of a city, and rules for creating and appreciating artistic creations as well as magical objects. (freely translated from the introduction)

168193.name: L'Élixir de Haut-Rêve
168193.description:
user summary

A travelogue scenario for experienced players.

168194.name: Lännen Maat - Roolipeli valoon astumisesta
168194.description:
Translated from back of the book:
Totally new gaming pleasure!
Lännen Maat (eng. Western Lands) brings you and your friends to ancient Egypt's mythic scenery and enchanting adventures. In this totally new kind of social storytelling game all players are actively involved in game events.

One of the players controls his/her character, the Wanderer through dangers of Duat. Other players act as a group in the roles of ancient egyptian gods, setting up physical and verbal challenges for the Wanderer. The Wanderer's journey towards light culminates in massive Halls of Truth, where gods research his by-gone life and lay upon fair judgement on him.

Lännen Maat is easy and nice game, which is based on historical facts. It doesn't use random results or -tables. Only your own skills and the favorability of gods will decide, will your dead ancient-egyptian character be permitted to the sun-kissed fields of Osiris or will he/she end up as the meal of horrible Sin-eater.

So step with out fear into the world of Anubis and Osiris to witness, what the afterlife of ancient egyptians was like.

Back of the book in finnish:
Ennenkokematonta pelinautintoa!
Lännen Maat vie sinut ja ystäväsi muinaisen Egyptin myyttisiin maisemiin ja kiehtoviin seikkailuihin. Tässä täysin uudenlaisessa sosiaalisessa kerrontapelissä kaikki pelaajat ovat aktiivisetsi mukana pelin tapahtumissa.

Pelaajista yksi ohjaa hahmoaa Kulkijaa Manalan vaarojen halki. Muut pelaajat toimivat ryhmänä muinaisten egyptiläisten jumalien rooleissa, asettaen Kulkijalle sekä fyysisiä että sanallisia haasteita. Kulkijan matka kohti valoa huipentuu jyhkeissä Totuuden saleissa, joissa jumalat tutkivat hänen menneen elämänsä ja langettavat sitten hänelle oikeudenmukaisen tuomion.

Lännen Maat on helppo ja mukava peli, joka pohjautuu historiallisiin tosiasioihin. Siinä ei käytetä satunniastuloksia eikä -taulukoita. vain oma taitosi ja tietysti jumalten suopeusratkaisevat, pääseekö muinaisegyptiläinen hahmosi kuolemansa jälkeen auringon kultaamille Osiriksen pelloille vai joutuuko hän kammottavan Syntisten nielijän ateriaksi.

Astu siis Anubiksen ja Osiriksen valtakuntaan kokemaan, millaista oli muiniasen egyptiläisen kuolemanjälkeinen elämä.

168195.name: As The Tea Leaves Grow
168195.description:
From first page of PDF:

Small Toad – youngest student of Master Iron Willow – gave the rarest tea flower in Master Iron Willow's considerable collection to a passing beauty. Whether she smiles when she looks at it, Master Iron Willow was not pleased by the absence. He tasked Small Toad and his four Brothers to journey the Empire in search of a tea leaf to rival the missing one.

Shamelessly inspired by: John Harper's Lady Blackbird and Vincent Baker's Apocalypse World with a heavy dose of Martial Arts Action!

user comment
there is no publication year on the PDF

168196.name: Mathe-monster
168196.description: Players take turns revealing tiles showing numbers and mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and score points for correctly solving the revealed equations. The first player to score four points wins.

rpgitemversion.257342: 2009 Flip Book w/ 4th ed Players Handbook and 3rd ed Monsters & Treasure

168197.name: Castles & Crusades Flip Book
168197.description:
Publishers Blurb:

Sourcebook, 272 pages, Softcover, includes Players Handbook and Monsters & Treasure

Players Handbook

Here the brave take up sword and shield, bring sorcery to bear, call upon eldritch powers that only the wise dare use, or slip through the shadows to tread gloried paths of danger. With grim resolve, adventurers plunge into the maelstrom of uncertainty to plunder the dragon's horde. They track the wastelands and wilderness and creep into the dark, hidden places of the world to arrest the monstrous foe of his treasure. These are adventurers, bold and brave, heroes of renown. These are the characters of Castles & Crusades.

Monsters & Treasure

Upon the Edge of Battle lie the Spoils of Glory. Upon wind-swept battlefields, they seek their glory. With weapons of steel, stout shields, and sorcery, they drive ever onward, seeking the grandeur of conflict with creatures of terrible wrath or beasts of legend. In every hour of every day, they gird themselves for war and struggle; to drive those evil beings of foul intent to doom and oblivion. But before glory can be obtained, before fame and riches can be won by these heroes of renown, they must face and overcome the monsters that would oppose them.

168198.name: Railyard: Match-3 Evolved
168198.description:
Railyard is a match-3 evolved to realtime action puzzle game, fast and intensive, with lots of unnecessary visual details that doesn’t help you and random weird stuff happening whether you want it or not, complete with awesome country barbecue blues and startling sound effects. Did I mention the game is hard? It gets harder the more you play.

Source: The Developer Website.

168199.description: Part 10 of the regular Black Stories series without a special theme.
168199.name: Black Stories 10

168200.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 65 - Oct 2014)
168200.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people of that area. Full color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided on the hex itself, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up of the hex, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Shabon
Nature’s Ways school of magic
Order of the Silvermoon

168201.description: A limited best-of-edition celebrating Black Stories' 10 year anniversary with 100 cards (twice the size of a normal edition) taken from Black Stories 1 through 10.
168201.name: Black Stories: Jubiläumsedition Best of 1-10

168202.name: Tales of Tamar
168202.description:
Publisher Info

Tales of Tamar, or ToT for short, is a turn based massively multiplayer PBEM (Play By E-Mail) game. Thousands of players can play with and against each other on a fantasy world. Players send their turns to the server using the software client, the server computes the results and sends them back to the player. The fun is in interacting with the other players. Each player in this role playing game/rpg takes the role of the sovereign leader of a country and has to build from the small village to a large realm. You can trade, wage wars and use any diplomatic measure imaginable.

Currently, up to 12000 players can take part in Tales of Tamar. There is one turn per day

168203.description: Played with a grid of 30 tiles, each showing either a colored treasure or the Loch Ness monster. Players take turns rolling a die, then revealing as many tiles as they wish. The player may keep all treasures that match the color on the die. If at any point the player reveals the Loch Ness monster, then her turn ends and the tiles are returned face-down to the table.
168203.name: Wilde Wikinger: Schatzjagd

168204.name: Sesam, puzzle dich!
168204.description: Players simultaneously reveal a set of path cards and attempt to be first to arrange them into a treasure map. Whoever is fastest gets the most valuable treasure. After four rounds, the player with the most treasure wins.

168205.description: On her turn, a player takes a color card and a picture card. The other players then take turns rolling the dice and asking whether the color and/or picture shown on the dice matches the selected item. Whoever first guesses the correct item gets a bear card, and the first player to collect three bear cards wins.
168205.name: Ich sehe was ...

168206.name: Superior Superheroes: Monster Mash
168206.description:
From publisher blurb:

Superior Superheroes: Monster Mash is a collection of pregenerated characters that can be added to any M&M 3rd Edition game. This book contains Five pregenerated superheroes with information on their team dynamics and a write up on their nemesis: the villainous El Diablo! All character point totals are noted on each character's sheet for easy customization by players or GMs!

Superior Superheroes: Monster Mash includes:

Frankie: A voluptuous vixen stitched together from El Diablo's victims.
Lynn: A lady lycanthrope who uses her curse for the cause of justice.
Victoria: A discarded bride of Dracula, seeking survival through heroics.
Doc: A student of science and mystery, fighting against the darkness for vengeance.
Igor: Doc's lab assistant and faithful sidekick.




Also included

El Diablo: An honest-to-badness demon bent on world domination.
Information on El Diablo's cult.

168207.name: Primetris
168207.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game is announced but has not been released yet and is NOT sold yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.





Developer descriptionInstructions (what you need to know to play):

The game is made of a 6 * 6 grid of tiles, each tile holding a number
There is a time bar on the right of the screen-. Should it become empty, it's game over
you must combine adjacent tiles whose sum is a prime number (a prime number is a number only divisible by two numbers : 1 and itself)
Click on a tile to select it (it turns blue) then click on the adjacent tile (left, right, up or down, no diagonal) and if their sum is prime, they will merge and their sum will be added to your score. if the sum isn't prime, they won't merge and you'll have a small time penalty.
When two tiles successfully merge, the value of adjacent tiles will slightly decrease
If you click on a tile per mistake, you can re-click it to deselect it, or click a non adjacent tile.




Additional information.

Once you reach a score of 100, 300, 600, 900... you level up (a special sound is played to tell you that). The time bar decreases a bit faster and new tiles can have a higher value when you reach a higher level.
The higher the sum of merged tiles, the biggest the decrease in adjacent tiles.
Prime tiles are red, non-prime are green. This is mostly to add a bit of color, but also helps in the search of "matching" tiles : the sum of two prime numbers is never prime (except when one of them is 2)




Source: Developer Description.

168208.name: Pokémon Art Academy
168208.description:
Pokémon Art Academy (ポケモンアートアカデミー Pokemon Āto Akademī?) is an educational drawing video game for the Nintendo 3DS developed by Headstrong Games and published by Nintendo. It is a spin-off of the Art Academy series featuring characters from the Pokémon media franchise, and was first released in Japan in June 2014, followed by English releases in Europe and Australia the following July, and North America in October. The game is available as both a retail release and downloadable game from the Nintendo eShop, and is the first 3DS title with built-in Miiverse support for sharing artwork.

Pokémon Art Academy is an educational art game designed to teach players how to draw various Pokémon characters through 40 advancing lessons. Players progress through three skill levels - Novice, Apprentice, and Graduate - while learning new techniques and art concepts, with additional tools such as pastel and paintbrush being unlocked along the way. The Novice course begins with skills such as drawing head-on portraits, angles, and construction shapes, while later stages introduce shading, hatching, opacity, and freehand sketches. Each drawing can be transferred to a Pokémon Trading Card Game card border upon completion, with the option to add a background image.

The game also includes a Free Paint Mode that allows players to draw whatever they wish, with the option to load templates as reference, as well as Quick Sketch Mode, which requires making a simple drawing with limited tools. Additional templates can be obtained by progressing through lessons, or as downloadable content through special promotions over Nintendo Network. Pokémon Art Academy features Miiverse functionality that allows for drawings to be uploaded to Nintendo's Miiverse Community, as well as take part in art contests.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Art Academy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

168209.name: Monsters of the Hydra
168209.description:
Adventurers seek to slay a nine headed hydra that has unleashed a myriad of monsters into the world.

This game contains tiles, chits, cards and dice.

Players win the game by either defeating the lead nine headed hydra and/or the head vampiress. The game is lost when all tiles are placed unless using the optional rule for infinite enemies.

To defeat all of the monsters, the players can gather weapons from the item deck by buying them at a shop or by using spells from the spell deck. Some items can also be found when defeating enemies.

168210.description:
The Glorious Fall is a dynamic, competitive/cooperative game with minimized luck. It recreates the entire epic lifespan of the Byzantine Empire, from the founding by Constantine the Great to its last gasp (or not, if you manage to keep it intact).

During play your Dynasty will be given a choice of secret destinies, such as keeping the empire alive, destroying it, or controlling the Basileus through two consecutive Eras, etc., and a number of Byzantine Plot cards to use when you choose. The map consists of the Themes of the Empire, with three "resources" contained in each: people, religious ferver, and commerce.

The game is won by the family accumulating the most Glory Points by the end of the final era in any combination of three ways: fulfilling your Dynasty's unique, secret destinies, developing the Themes (regions) within the empire, and shaping the empire to suit your purposes while denying other's their revealed plans.

Your family will dominate various roles throughout the game: Basileus (Emperor), Logothete (Administrator), Patriarch, Strategos (General), or Katepano (control the mobs of Constantinople). Each title grants limited political power, forcing cooperation, but each can seize unlimited political power at various times when Byzantine Plots are revealed and anyone can suddenly seize control of the Basileus' actions, or even the throne itself.

Roles switch when players reveal plots of various strengths by using Byzantine Plot cards. In essence assassinating the Emperor in favor of their own candidate; misleading an Army sent to defend Jerusalem, convincing it to go to Cilicia instead; or denying the Basileus the power to hand out political favors, instead forcing him to divide the power as your dynasty sees fit.

Each family (player) has only so much political power to expend at any time, and must choose when to intervene and when to let the Basileus (or another family) have their way.

Throughout the game, the Empire faces Barbarian invasions from its borders, and possible rebellions from within. Players will create alliances that may last or end before ever begun as nefarious plots are revealed. The Basileus may see Crusades or merchant enclaves rise up to restore parts of the Empire or betray the Empire and sack the Queen of Cities.
168210.name: The Glorious Fall

168211.name: L-Tiles
168211.description:
Join tiles edge to edge to expand your territory and finally turn your areas into victory points
Watch out though, making your areas too big detracts from your score and can even lead to losing points
Can you keep your areas at just the right size to get the highest score?
It's a territory control game with concise rules and interesting dilemmas

168215.description:
Saboteur: Duel is a standalone version of the famous card game Saboteur for one and two players. When playing alone, you want to collect as much gold as possible by digging new tunnels in the mine; when playing with an opponent, you'll just want to collect more than that player, but naturally your opponent will try to block your progression by all means.

In this card game, you play path or action cards. The path cards form a maze in the direction of the six goal cards, which contain a variable number of gold stones. The action cards are used to hinder your opponent or to help you to repair broken equipment. A greedy troll also lurks in the mine, and you will have to pay him to progress and he doesn't give back any change!
168215.name: Saboteur: The Duel

168216.description:
This 2014 promo card for The Rivals for Catan was given out by Klaus Teuber at SPIEL 2014 in Essen (and can also be bought in the Catan Shop).

It is a unit/hero.
It costs 1 grain and 1 wool and has 1 skill point.
It has an orange "Zeit des Goldes" (Era of Gold) back.

Text of the card:
"Legen Sie Arnd neben 1 Goldfluss-Landschaft. Wird die Zahl des Goldflusses gewürfelt, dürfen Sie, statt 1 Gold zu nehmen, die andere benachbarte Landschaft um eine Stufe hochdrehen."

This translates to:
Place Arnd next to a gold region. If the number of this gold region is rolled, you may, instead of taking 1 gold, take a resource on the other adjacent region.
168216.name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte 2014 – Arnd, der Fischer

168217.name: Palace of the Silver Princess (Orange)

rpgpodcastepisode.14648: The Save or Die Podcast: Interview with Jean Wells

168217.description:
From the Front Cover:

Years ago the valley was green, and animals ran free through golden fields of grain. The princess Argenta rules over this peaceful land and the people were secure and happy. Then one day a warrior riding a red dragon appeared in the skies over the princess' castle and almost overnight the tiny kingdom fell into ruin. Now only ruins and rumors remain, and what legends there are tell of a fabulous ruby still buried somewhere within the Palace of the Silver Princess.

This module is for use with the D&D Basic rules and is specially designed for beginning players and DMs. Contained within are maps of the palace and its dungeons, background information, and rumors and legends as well as many new monsters.

168218.description:
Nixe Irja (Mermaid Irja) is the first promo for Legends of Andor: Journey north.

She fell in love with one of the heroes and waits for him every dawn. Position Irja with the roll of a red die. Determine a hero by uncovering a coat of arms.
If this heros is on Irjas field or next to it at dawn he gets with a die roll of 1,2 / 3,4 / 5,6 a present: 2 gold / 1 strength / 1 fame. And Irja moves to the rolled field.
If he is not the heroes loose 1 fame. Determine also a new hero by uncovering a coat of arms (may be the same). Also position Irja via die roll anew.
168218.name: Legends of Andor: The Mermaid Iria

156318.name: Legends of Andor: Journey to the North

168220.name: Deal, Gentlemen Collectionneurs
168220.description:
You are playing the roles of millionaires who collect mysterious artefacts from the four corners of the earth. Apparently, when collected in threes, these objects have amazing powers. Auctions bore you, so instead you and your rivals have to agree on how to divvy up each load of artefacts. In each round, three objects must be divided up between two players. Each person takes what he or she wishes – if the other person agrees! Is it a deal?

In each round (or Deal), place 3 artefact cards in the middle of the table: 2 face up and 1 face down. Two players must agree on how to divide up these 3 cards. Attention: all the cards must go somewhere; none can be set aside. Cards from previous rounds cannot be exchanged. Negotiations are free and open. They end as soon as both players accept a proposal and say, “DEAL!”
Once an agreement has been reached, the 2 players each take their share and place it behind their own screens. The player who has obtained the face-down card can look at it (secretly or openly) and put it with his or her other cards.
The game ends with there are no more cards in the stack.

168222.name: Sir Reginald Lichlyter's Trusty Tavern Tome
168222.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sir Reginald Lichlyter, owner of the Wine & Spirit Emporium, is back to bring you hundreds of new alcoholic beverages from standard ales, fantastical wines, and magic liquors! This tome provides expanded rules for drinking (while keeping the mechanics simple), breaks down the various types of beverages (while providing hundreds of examples), and even provides an assortment of rare alchemical and magical booze to keep any dwarf happy!

Every drink presented in this book comes with a detailed description of its color, taste, and production process as well as how it is typically served, where to find it, etc.

But that's not all! Inside you'll also find simple rules for your adventuring party to run their very own tavern or inn! Pour over the lists of supplies you'll need, study the various types of establishments, and roll the dice to see what types of profits you made today!

168223.name: Construct Feats
168223.description:
From publisher blurb:

Construct Feats brings you 7 brand-new mythic feats designed especially for the colossal constructs and magnificent monoliths in your mythic game, from defensive abilities like Antimagic Aura and Resilient Construct to offensive feats like Smashing Stomp and utility feats like Programmable Construct!

168224.name: Caves: Large Caverns
168224.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Caves - Large Caverns is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Caves - Large Caverns comprises 10 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations, and combined with maps from the Modular Caves set.

Included:

PDF printable sheets, with both gridded and non-gridded versions
A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.
A sheet of wall and floor textures, for custom wall layouts




This set is compatible with the 2.5D crafting system, a crafting technique for making dungeon tiles more than 2D but not quite 3D.

168225.name: Another Bunch of Content (Issue 1 - Nov 2014)
168225.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the first issue of the monthly system neutral series Another Bunch of Content! Each month, InfiniBadger Press brings you 26 new pieces of open content for you to use in your games, one for each letter of the alphabet. Monsters, items, locations, people, encounters, dungeons, and a slew of anything else that that we think that you might be interested in will all be put together into these jam-packed system-neutral newsletters for your gaming utility and pleasure.

168226.description: A second part of the Black Stories edition about morbidly funny cases of death which happened in reality.
168226.name: Black Stories Funny Death Edition 2

168227.name: Black Stories 11
168227.description: Part 11 of the regular Black Stories series without a special theme. One of the cards included is Ärztlicher Rat, which was given out as a promo card at SPIEL Essen 2014.

boardgameimplementation.60012: Second World War at Sea: Spice Islands

168228.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Return to the world of the Second Great War, where Wilson’s Peace ended the First Great War on Christmas 1916. Twenty-four years later war returned to Europe, with Russia, France and Italy seeking to overturn the settlement with a war of aggression against the Central Powers of Imperial Germany, Austria-Hungary and the Ottoman Empire.

Royal Netherlands Navy is the third book in our alternative history series, The Second Great War. In the first book, The Kaiser’s Navy, we looked at the High Seas Fleet of 1940 and its campaigns in the North Sea and Atlantic. In the second, The Habsburg Fleet, the Imperial and Royal Austro-Hungarian Navy, alongside its Turkish allies, wages war in the Mediterranean Sea.

In this volume, the fleet the Dutch admirals hoped to build in our world, but could not get approved, finds itself pressured by the Japanese in the Far East and the British and French in Europe. Defending their rights with armed force, the Dutch find themselves drawn into desperate battles in the North Sea, North Atlantic, South China Sea and the interior waters of the East Indies.

In the 1930s, Dutch shipyards stood at the leading edge of naval technology: Dutch submarines first deployed the schnorkel breathing device, for example, and Dutch warships boasted the sophisticated Hazemeyer fire control system that would be enthusiastically copied by the Royal Navy and others. The Netherlands had the industrial and financial means to create a large and modern fleet, and the oil wealth of Borneo and Sumatra provided the motive. Seeing deficits as a more lethal enemy than the Axis, the Dutch government of our reality doomed both the home country and the colonies to defeat and occupation. In the world of Wilson's Peace, things are a little different.

There are 210 die-cut and mounted playing pieces from the old, out-of-print Spice Islands booklet, and 90 brand-new laser-cut pieces (scorchless and sootless!) for 300 total: 120 double-sized "long" ship pieces and 180 standard-sized ones representing task forces, aircraft and smaller warships. The Dutch fleet that never was is present, along with French, British, Japanese and German ships, aircraft and airships. Yes, airships!

There are also thirty new scenarios based on the battles that might have been waged by the Royal Netherlands Navy in this alternate world, plus more of the story of the Second Great War begun in The Kaiser's Navy and continued in The Habsburg Fleet. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Strike South and Eastern Fleet to enjoy all of the scenarios.
168228.name: Second World War at Sea: Royal Netherlands Navy

5702.name: Second World War at Sea: Eastern Fleet

168229.name: There Was A Dark, Dark House
168229.description:
From publisher blurb:

There Was A Dark, Dark House is a Halloween adventure for the FirstFable RPG published by OneBookShelf.

This tale is inspired by ghost stories told around a campfire. It can be as scary or funny as you want.

Your children will love playing an active part in this spooky tale!

168230.description:
The Supershow is a tabletop dice and card game for 2 - 6 players. Supershow is the worlds first UCG, or unpredictable card game that takes place in the underground wrestling word of the Legendary Fighting Federation. The goal of the game is to hit your FINISH card for a chance to defeat your opponent.

When competing in the Legendary Fighting Federation competitors use the Lead - Follow up - Finish game engine, which makes the game easy to pick up by impossible to put down.

The LFF Engine is simple, on a players turn; they may play 1 card, that card can be; a FINISH card if they have a FOLLOW UP in play. A FOLLOW UP card if they have a LEAD in play. Or they may play a LEAD card. After each card is played, all players roll their Skill dice; the player who rolled the highest Skill draws a card and starts his turn. When a FINISH card is played a player has a chance to defeat his opponent with a dice roll, if he does not all cards in play are discarded, the Crowd Meter is raised to the next level and the game continues. The Crowd Meter increased the effectiveness of the FINISH cards as the game progresses.

When a FINISH card is played, a player attempts to PIN or SUBMIT his opponent with a FINISH ROLL. They roll their Skill dice to decide the FINISH ROLL. Their opponent has 3 dice rolls, called BREAKOUT ROLLS, to beat or tie the FINISH ROLL. This simulates beating the referees 3 count, or grabbing the ropes before the lifeless arm falls for the 3 time.

The Skill dice correlates with the Skill chart on the Competitor card you have selected. Each Competitor has a Gimmick, a unique effect that affects the game play, and 3 Finish cards. The 3 Finish cards are added to your Supershow Deck at the start of the game, and are also unique to that competitor.

Currently there are 7 playable competitors, each with their own unique backstory and interaction in the game. Additional characters can be won at our events, downloaded for free off our website, are handed out at live shows, or can purchased which each new set.
Each deck in The Supershow is comprised of 30 cards and 1 Competitor card that have a Skill chart. These pre-constructed 30 cards are 15 Lead cards, 12 Follow Up cards, and 3 Finish cards. Your Finish cards are unique to your Competitor. These cards can be different colors, making them Strikes, Grapples, or Submissions. Your Strikes, Grapples, and Submissions can become harder or easier to stop depending on your Skill chart and the Skill chart of your opponent.
Stop cards can be used to stop your opponent’s moves.

The Supershow also has mechanics that for multiplayer formats, triple threat, four way, 2-4 player tag team, tornado tag team, each format can be elimination style, or first to Finish. This is on top of different match types that are played with no additional purchases, such as escape the cage or submission match.
168230.name: The Supershow

168231.description:
Released in october 2014.

Contains:

St. Francis of Assisi: was an Italian Catholic friar and preacher. He founded the men's Order of Friars Minor, the women’s Order of St. Clare, and the Third Order of Saint Francis for men and women not able to live the lives of itinerant preachers, followed by the early members of the Order of Friars Minor, or the monastic lives of the Poor Clares. Though he was never ordained to the Catholic priesthood, Francis is one of the most venerated religious figures in history.
Barbarossa: Holy Roman Emperor, he got the name Barbarossa from the northern Italian cities he attempted to rule: Barbarossa means "red beard" in Italian. In German, he was known as Kaiser Rotbart, which has the same meaning.
Genghis Khan: was the founder and Great Khan (emperor) of the Mongol Empire, which became the largest contiguous empire in history after his demise.
Marco Polo: was an Italian merchant traveller. He was not the first European to reach China (see Europeans in Medieval China), but he was the first to leave a detailed chronicle of his experience.
168231.name: Rattus Bonus 2014

168232.description:
Study Parameters
The mind really can shape reality! Scientists have invented a machine that can tap into a person’s dreams and make them real. However, only the strongest minds--those who can control their dreaming--are able to utilize the machine. Thus Project Dreamscape was created to find the ultimate dreamer.

Study Goal
Participants will collect dream cards on their turns with the goal of chaining matching dream types together. The more dream cards a participant chains together, the more points that chain will score. The participant with the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

There are 8 dream types in the 52-card sleep deck, each of which appears exactly 13 times. Each dream card depicts 2 different dream types. Whenever you collect a dream card, you must choose one of the dream types to perform and follow its directions.
168232.name: Project Dreamscape

168233.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 8 - Fall 2014)
168233.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the eighth issue of Tsunami Quarterly Review, you will find the following great features:

RPG Crucible: Secrets: Tips for adding roleplaying depth by folding secrets into your character's past and timing their reveal in game.
Faces of Horror: JiB discusses the horror potential of characterizing elements of a game like you do NPCs.
Mercy Hospital: A bonus Mortiston location for your zombie apocalypse scenario.
Anything But the 10-Foot Pole: Guest writer John Jones explores the theme of exploration for 4E D&D players moving into 5E.
