Each monster is presented in three variations, one for 1st level adventurers, one for 5th level, and one for 10th level. As a result, it's easy to tweak the monsters for any party from 1st to 10th level.

In addition, each piece of dialogue is presented in two columns: a carefully-written piece of dialogue that you can read as "boxed text," and a detailed summary that you can customize according to your preferred speech patterns.

The full-color artwork and maps have been carefully color-corrected to print perfectly on color and black-and-white printers. The module includes maps that will print in standard one-inch squares on a normal piece of paper.

168322.name: Betcha Can't Win
168322.description:
Step right up and roll the dice! This colorful “boardwalk” theme creates a fun carnival like game experience. Roll as many times as you like to try to match the sum on the Number Cards but be careful there is a price to pay!

Roll dice and combine their sums to match target sums displayed on number cards. Collect the number cards you match and secure their points if no other player can match their target sum that round. Secure the most points by the end of the game to win!

168323.name: The Mystery of the Shattered World
168323.description:
From publisher blurb:

Master Andreas, the world's foremost adventurer and scholar, has vanished. One of his apprentices has compiled this 44-page manuscript of notes and materials to guide you to the many places in the world where he might be. Can you unravel the Mystery of the Shattered World?

This is a sandbox setting for a new fantasy world that's ideal for adventuring. Three growing empires struggle for dominance in a world blasted into small islands, where magic doesn't work on the high seas and lawlessness is the rule.

This book includes:

A history of the world, from the Time of Chains through the War of Claw and Fire to the Clash of the Three Kingdoms.
7 political and social factions
11 cities and other locations
20 NPCs
11 monsters
An encyclopedia of common terms, equipment, food, drink, poisons, and antidotes




Moreover, this book is designed to inspire you with new ideas. Looking for a new twist on kobolds or bugbears? Need a shadowy criminal faction? Look here.

168324.name: Letter Slide
168324.description:
Take a fast paced ride down the Letter Slide!

Don't "slide" by the letter tiles that you need. Spell as many words as you can based on the card that has been turned over. Hurry before the timer runs out!

Grab Letter Tiles to complete as many four-letter words as you can before the time runs out. Place one Letter Tile from each correctly spelled word onto a corresponding letter space. Cover all the Letter Spaces on your Slide Board first to win the game!

168325.name: Perspectives
168325.description:
It's all about Perspective!!

Move the brightly colored Game Tiles around on the board to create one or more patterns from your “Perspective”. Solve your Pattern Cards even when it is not your turn but pay close attention and be quick so you do not miss out on a winning opportunity!

Match the Pattern Cards to patterns on the Game Board to earn points. Move Game Tiles to create new patterns and opportunities for more points. Score the most points from matched patterns to win Perspectives!

168326.name: Who's Like Me?
168326.description:
Who's Like Me? You may be surprised how much we all have in common.

In Who's Like Me?, children learn how to recognize emotions in their friends and see what they all have in common. This game develops skills like observation, memory, distinguishing and grouping multiple elements, and sharing emotions. Make matches and earn points. Score the most points and win the game!

168327.name: Der Schmuggler von Delebuan
168327.description:
translated from the back of the book

an adventure by Sascha Lellmann

Two warring worlds. A fragile peace. A common enemy.
And the player characters in the middle. In such circumstances, a mission run smoothly? Not if still intrigues, political interests, and old rivalries come into play.
What at first appears as a simple prisoner transfer turns out to be unexpected confusion in which no party is really interested, to comply with agreements made​​. And yet the prisoners then attempted to enforce its own conception of the course of transportation, it comes for the player characters really heavy.
Between firefights, crash landings, betrayal and ambiguous loyalties there for the player characters in "The smuggler of Delebuan" primarily to do one thing: find out who the good guys and who are the bad guys and who they can trust.

This adventure was made for Beginners.

168328.name: Duo Dash
168328.description:
The animals are loose and must be brought back into the enclosures as fast as possible. If only someone could remember where the animals were last!

Dash quickly as you and the other players turn over tiles to collect pairs of animals. Find pairs according to the Goal Tiles. Match a valid pair and receive a positive point, collect a wrong pair and receive a negative point. Score the most points at the end of 3 rounds and win!

168330.name: Bubbles and Puddles
168330.description:
For each game, the set up and game play is the same, but the game objectives are slightly different. In the Bubbles game, the last player to have at least one Bubbles Tile left in their section wins the game! In the Puddles game, the first player to remove all the Puddle Tiles from their section wins the game!

Roll the Die to move the Rubber Duck and discard the Tile where the Rubber Duck lands. Replace a Tile from the discard pile when you roll the Duck Symbol. To Win the Bubbles game be the last player with a Tile left in Play. To win the Puddles game be the first player to remove all your Tiles.

168331.name: Eat & Tweat
168331.description:
Help your birdies fly home as they collect tasty tidbits of food to move around the landscape tiles.

As your birds move ahead, reveal more of the landscape tiles opening new paths to explore. Try to reach your nest with as much food energy as you can. The bird who reaches the nest with the most food wins!

168332.name: Cross Lanes
168332.description: In Cross Lanes, place your card at a 90 degree angle covering a card value that is one higher or one lower than the value of your card. Cover two halves in any orientation and score a Spare or a Strike. Be the first player to place all of your cards and win the game. Be careful if you don't have a play or a Gutterball may be headed your way!

168333.name: Front Runner
168333.description:
Exercise your math factoring skills and make your horse the Front Runner. The first horse to cross the finish line wins the race. Solve equations using the dice by plugging in the missing numbers needed to solve the equation.

Feeling fearless? Use a Second Wind card to re-roll the dice and try again. Falling behind? Use a Nose Ahead card for a chance to make up some ground. Solving for multiple operators? Follow the 3 rules for Order of Operations and run a smooth race.

168335.name: Fourmation
168335.description:
Fourmation is an amazing new game that elegantly combines math with strategy.

The object is to connect four zones in a row: up, down or diagonally. But in order to place your colored marker, you'll have to make the number on the desired spot from the sum of one or more of the number cards in your hand. Outnumber all other players in a contested zone to put it back under your control and complete the winning "fourmation"!

The game board can be turned and rearranged to create a different layout every time. This is a fun alternative to flash cards for upper level addition that your kids will love.

168336.name: Tibbar's Mix to Match
168336.description:
Tibbar is painting the town red, and orange... and even blue-green!

In Mix to Match, your kids will learn how to combine colors to create secondary and tertiary shades. Send Tibbar around his painter's palette to get to the color shown on one of your cards. Match all of your colors first to win the game.

168338.name: Bypass
168338.description:
In this game, your challenge is to build or share a roadway built by others to navigate from one side of the board to the other. Drop a traffic cone to protect a route you like, or "Bypass" one you don't. Make sure to watch for other players' roadways to 'break' them up before they have a complete route. Be the first person to complete a route to win.

On each turn, play one of your roadway tiles somewhere on the game board. You don't have to play the tiles in any particular order, and your route doesn't need to be straight - but over the twists and turns it must eventually create a path joining your color on both sides of the game board. Remember that all players share the roadway system, so try not to help someone finish ahead of you. After playing a roadway tile, draw a replacement and then the next player on your left takes their turn. Only after a tile has been surrounded on all four sides, players may stack a different tile on top of it, changing the route dramatically!

168339.name: The Orc
168339.description:
subtitle
A Supplement for the Original Role-Playing Game & Inspired Products

from the back of the book:
Diet and lifestyle, villages, caves, warfare, slavery, sense of honor, great spirits, money, shamans and even orcs as a PC class: everything you need for orcs in your original role-playing game campaign.

user note
The PDF has no cover art, the title page serves as the cover.

168341.name: 9th Dawn
168341.description:
Are you a fan of oldschool RPGs like Ultima, but crave the openness and exploration of modern games? If so, we at Valorware are dedicated to giving you just that! We are proud to present 9th Dawn, a game that's a blend of modern and traditional design and gameplay and sports the largest open world experience available today in a mobile RPG!

Explore the large island of Montelorne, a land far detached from the mainland, but filled with mystery, danger, and last but not least, adventure. You begin your journey in the small village of Agaria, but once you gain your bearings, you'll find yourself immersed in a world of its own.

Play as one of three of the traditional classes: The sturdy knight, skilled in the art of combat and possessing the ability to wield heavy armour and weapons; the nimble archer, capable of swiftly dispatching a foe from afar or close up with his daggers; the wise mage, a master of the elements and capable of utilizing powerful magic spells and summoning abilities to obliterate the enemy.

Whether it's searching for hidden artifacts and treasure, helping the troubled Montelornians with the rising undead armies, or simply exploring the massive world and it's many towns, dungeons, and forests, there is no shortage of fun for a bold adventurer to partake of!

Features

Massive Open World - explore foreboding forests, dark dungeons and crumbling castles.
Quest throughout Montelorne and it's neighbouring isles to learn more about the nation of Caspatia and leave your mark upon it!
Fight through hordes of undead and dangerous beasts - over 100 unique enemies with different abilities and behaviours stand in your way!

Source: The Developer Website.

168342.description:
The Three Kingdoms Redux generals' illustration booklet contains the artwork of all 69 generals in the base game. Only the artwork is presented; All iconology, skill description etc. have been excluded.

This illustration booklet is not required for gameplay, but helps players develop an appreciation of the historical background of each general and the scene depicted on each general card.
168342.name: Three Kingdoms Redux: Generals' Illustration Booklet

168343.name: Der Völkerkrieg
168343.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 100; become really positive about Germany's war occurences
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on red spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...

Note:
Likely published ~1915; indoctrination related to spirit of the age & time

168344.name: The Old School Renaissance Handbook
168344.description:
From publisher blurb:

You may have heard of the Old School Renaissance, an enthusiastic movement that champions old-school gaming and old-school systems.

Here's the problem: there are dozens of old school rule sets. So which one should you try?

The Old School Renaissance Handbook profiles 28 popular old-school systems, including their basic mechanics, character attributes, and advice for DMs and players. There's even a handy one-page table comparing all these systems on price and complexity.

Plus, the book stats out the same five first-level characters in all 28 systems. Compare systems easily, and quickly jump into a game with these pregens.

The Handbook also includes interviews with Kirin Robinson of Old School Hack, James Raggi III of Lamentations of the Flame Princess, Jason Morningstar of Dungeon Squad!, Larry Moore of BareBones, Michael Wolf of Warrior, Rogue & Mage, and Sage LaTorra and Adam Koebel of Dungeon World.

168345.name: Trick or Treat
168345.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is one street that should never be visited on such a night as Halloween. A dark, gloomy street where the wind whispers of death and mists ward off the sun's rays even in summer. No one knows who lives there and no one wants to, just so long as the residents keep themselves to themselves. No houses ever come on the market and it is impossible to imagine there could be any buyers were one ever to do so. Even the rats and crows stay away...

168346.name: Die wilden Fußballkerle: Geheimtraining
168346.description:
In Geheimtraining (secret training) you try to pass the ball which is a disc to your team mates by flickikng it. Around each player pawn lies a rubberband to indicate the area in which you have to land the ball to successfully pass it.

The player who passes 11 perfect shots and shoots a goal wins the game.

168347.name: Der Völkerkrieg
168347.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching Paris (space 46); become really positive about Germany's war occurences
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Board shows German/French/Belgium Border with two separate ways (Aachen or Metz) towards Paris.
Choose one of the two routes. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on red marked spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...
Note:
Likely published 1915; indoctrination related to spirit of the age & time

168349.name: Der Brummer kommt!
168349.description:
Objective: Flip carton discs into areas of different values in the box base and colored circles of the erected castle.

Instructions show relations to events of WWI:
Cannon (on the cover) is described as "Krupp's 42 cm mortar", successfully used during WWI.

168351.name: Thunder Patrol
168351.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thunder Patrol is the most famous, well-funded and powerful (i.e. the best) superhero team in the world. They have prevented countless alien invasions, extinction-events, wars, and peaceful democratic revolutions. Wherever there is a threat to the status quo the Thunder Patrol is there to squash it under the mighty jackboot of justice.

Everything you need to add the Thunder Patrol to your game is here, the characters, the fun and the funny.

168352.name: Rogues Gallery
168352.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rogues Gallery are the worst of the worst, the biggest villains in the world. Enough said…

Everything you need to add the Rogues Gallery to your game is here, the characters, the fun and the funny.

168353.name: 2 Hour Dungeon Crawl
168353.description:
From the publisher's website:

No smoke, no mirrors, just a great game!

What: Dungeon Crawl

Scale: 1 figure or counter represents 1 man or creature

Your Role: Players lead a party of Adventurers into a dungeon in search of Treasure and Fame. Save the Princess, kill some Monsters or grab some Loot, the choice is yours!

Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

2 Hour Dungeon Crawl can be played in a variety of ways and contains the following:

Fifteen different Races including Dwarves, Elves, Orcs, Trolls, Wizards, Barbarians, and much more.
Eight different Professions to breath life into your characters.
Rules for your characters to grow in skills and abilities as they succeed.
30+ Attributes to further define your characters.
Over 30 Magic Spells and Magical items for you to find and use.
A system that generates your dungeons, including the Monsters, while you play.




And even better.

Have those cool Dungeon Tiles? You can use them.

Want to go Old School and use Graph Paper? You can do it.

Have metal figures? Plastics? How about paper? Even counters? Yep, you can use them all.

Why?

Because it shouldn't cost an arm and leg for a great Dungeon Crawl...unless you run into a Troll!

2 Hour Dungeon Crawl
No smoke, no mirrors, just a great game.

168354.name: Shut the Front Door
168354.description:
Shut the Front Door is a simultaneously turned, fast paced matching game about childish insults. The deck contains 50 cards each with 6 childish insults and one compliment on them. There are 30 different insults spread among the cards.

The rules contain several variants but the main mechanic of each is to find matching words between cards, shout it out (Cootiehead!) and discard or add the cards to another pile faster than the other players. Variant rules include relay races, shouting out only the compliments, penalties for making mistakes and even drinking games for adult players.

Other decks in the series, available separately, share the same rules but have words with different themes such as Sci-Fi or Shakespearean insults.

168355.name: Köbes: Das Brauhausspiel
168355.description:
Köbes is a board game for two to four players from 12 years of age. The game is played in the dining room of a typical Cologne brewery/pub. Players assume the role of Köbes, a waiter who serves Kölsch (name used to describe beer in Cologne and Bonn). Each Köbes is his own entrepreneur. He must bring as many Kölsch as possible to the tables of his guests, that he previously purchased at the bar from the host brewer. But it's not as simple as it sounds, as there are always many obstacles in the way.

The game bases its mechanics on the well known and loved game Mensch Ärger Dich Nicht, which uses dice to move around the board. In Köbes, players also use dice rolls to advance their Köbes around the brewery/pub, but are not limited to just the rolled dice numbers.

168356.name: Land of Ice and Stone
168356.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in our distant past is a culture long forgotten, a culture so remote that all we have to remember it are dry bones, cave paintings and stone tools. However, this is a culture from whence we all sprang.

Play a traveller on a great journey, a wise woman leading her clan,or a bold hunter full of fear at his first mammoth kill.

Using the popular Legend RPG rules, Land of Ice and Stone provides a set of rules, races, cultural backgrounds, professions allowing you to play in the oldest of our cultures – the Old Stone Age.

So, come and face the fierce mammoths, the cave lions, cave bears, the strange red men and the most dangerous foe of all – the Icy Cold.

168357.name: Tome of Horrors 4 (Sword & Wizardry)
168357.description:
From publisher blurb:

This massive tome of never before seen monsters will be done in our characteristic textbook bound hardcover style, but this time in full color! Featuring over 300 new monsters from our design team led by Scott Greene and illustrated by Chris McFann, it provides new fiends to terrorize your players with for years to come. Both Swords & Wizardry and Pathfinder versions available.

One can simply never have enough monsters. The greatest trick a GM can play is to show up with something new that the players have never heard of before. Anyone who has been doing this for very long knows the drill, “Goblins, ok, fighters to the front so they get multiple attacks”, or “a troll! Get fire and acid ready!”.

Imagine what happened to the first group of players that encountered a nilbog—and watched it grow in size as the fighters each hit it 5 times. What about a pyrohydra—fire had no way to stop it from growing new heads… “Oh my, what do we do now?” may have been the next battlecry.

It’s not always necessary to make every monster a death-dealing enigma; however fear of the unknown is one of the strongest tools in the GM’s arsenal. It keeps players on their toes and makes the game more fun. Certainly the old mundane standbys need a place at the table (and the miniature case); after all, what is a dungeon without a troll or ten?

168358.name: Nervíky
168358.description:
A dexterity game.

NOTE: Nervíky (Czech/Slovak) = nerves (to be more precise: little nerves).

Set-up: One player (the catcher) has a small cup, and a die with different colours on its faces. The other players each have a differently-coloured wooden piece (yellow, red, green, or blue) with a string attached to it.

Aim of the game: Players try to receive the least amount of penalty points for their poor reaction times.

Game play:

Variant no. 1

The catcher rolls the die, if the roll is yellow, red, green, or blue, he/she tries to catch, with his/her cup, the colour rolled. If he/she rolls white, he/she attempts to catch all of the colours; if he/she rolls black, he/she is not allowed to catch anything. The other players, according to the result of the roll, either try to escape (by pulling on the string) or do nothing.

Variant no. 2

The catcher says three colours at random (e.g., green, blue, black) and rolls the die.
If he/she rolls one of the colours he/she said, he/she tries to catch as many of the other players as possible and the other players try to escape as quickly as possible (again by pulling on the string). If the catcher rolls a different colour than he/she said, the other players do nothing.

Scoring Points:

There is a penalty point to the catcher if he/she does not catch any of the other players, or if he/she accidentally catches any of the other players.

There is a penalty point to the other players (with coloured pieces with strings) if they are caught by the catcher, or if they accidentally pull their pieces back.

168359.name: Infinivaders

rpgseries.27242: Cartoon Action Hour Season 3 Series Book

168359.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this Cartoon Action Hour: Season 3 series book by John Wick, the extra-dimensional conqueror known as Dr. Zen is attempting to merge his darkened world with ours, which will spell doom for us all. Thankfully, heroes have emerged! Armed with objects of power granted to them by the spirits of their various homelands, these brave souls stand at the ready to defend Earth from... the Infinivaders!

168360.name: The Paranormal Entities of Holiday Present
168360.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when the stalwart heroes of the Ghost Patrol accidentally dispell the Ghosts of Holiday Spirit? Find out in this holiday-themed episode of the Ghost Patrol series from the CAH:S3 rulebook.

168361.name: Giant Transforming Robots

rpg.714: Cartoon Action Hour (Season One & Two Editions)

168361.description:
From publisher blurb:

This mini-sourcebook for the Cartoon Action Hour: Season 2 RPG is the ultimate resource for creating and playing (what else?) giant transforming robots! Within this document, you'll find:

An in-depth discussion about the GTR sub-genre!
More elaborate explanations for how GTRs are handled in the game!
Rules for all manner of unusual GTR variants (Headlords, Targetlords, DuoBots, Rockmasters, etc.)!
Rules for transforming in the heat of combat!
New Bonuses and Restrictions designed specifically for GTR characters!

168362.name: Erika
168362.description: The players place their 15 meeples on the game board, one per turn. When all meeples are on the board the players move their meeples one space at a time. When a player gets 5 of his meeples in a straight line, he may remove any one meeple of any opposing player. If he does this on the black spaces, forming the name "Erika" he may additionaly reenter one of his own removed meeples. If a player manages to occupy the "Erika" spaces of his own color, he wins the game. Another possible way to win the game is to occupy any black "Erika" spaces, the two spaces left and the two spaces right to the letter "I" in "Erika" (forming a cross).

168363.name: Cartoon Action Hour Season 2 Valentine's Day Special

rpg.714: Cartoon Action Hour (Season One & Two Editions)

168363.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of humankind’s most profound emotions is love… and what better time to talk about love than on Valentine’s Day? In the machismo-filed world of the retro-toons, love wasn’t something that was blatantly bandied about on a regular basis. The characters would rather duke it out or shoot at each other with lasers than engage in romantic situations. That having been said, romance wasn’t completely absent from the retro-toons. It was just muted and watered down a bit, making it more tolerable for the target audience.

This mini-sourcebook was written with one goal in mind: to help players and GMs introduce romantic elements into Cartoon Action Hour: Season 2 without violating everything that the retro-toons stood for.

The fist section deals with advice for integrating romance into the game, while the second section presents a series that explores romantic themes more than most others.

rpg.714: Cartoon Action Hour (Season One & Two Editions)

168364.name: Cartoon Action Hour Season 2 Halloween Special
168364.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween is more than just another holiday. It’s a time of year in which ghouls and goblins roam freely amongst the newly fallen leaves of brown and orange. It’s a time of year in which many people seek thrills and chills by going to “spook houses” or by watching an insane amount of horror flcks. But during the 1980s, it was also a time in which the networks showcased numerous animated Halloween Specials that kids of all ages could (and did) look forward to. In most cases, such specials were derived from a popular series of the time.

Along similar lines, it wasn’t unheard of for a series to have horror elements year-round rather than just a one-off special in October. Granted, the brand of horror demonstrated by these series was a far cry from that of the horror fims.

This document seeks to bring horror to your games of Cartoon Action Hour, whether you want to run a Halloween Special for your existing series or create a new series laden with horror trappings.

The fist section of the document deals evoking the appropriate style of horror into the game, offering hints, tips and advice. The second section presents a new horror-themed series, Creature Busters.

168365.name: Cartoon Action Hour Season 3 Primer
168365.description:
From publisher blurb:

This seven-page PDF document gives you a quick rundown of the game system basics. After reading this, you'll have a firm handle on how the game plays. It must be noted, though, that the rules are subject the change slightly before the game is published.

168366.name: Dinosaur Safari
168366.description:
In Dinosaur Safari, the player travels in time and photographs images of dinosaurs and other ancient reptiles for the "National Chronographic Society." Some of the more aggressive dinosaur species will attack the player's vehicle, the Kronos Sphere. As more species are photographed, the player gains access to power-ups such as a video recorder and a call to attract dinosaurs. Captured images and video footage of the dinosaurs are stored on crystals in the National Chronographic headquarters.

Source: Wikipedia.

168367.name: Adventurers!
168367.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers! is the new ultra-lite RPG from GRAmel. Made for Old School aficionados, it has a Player's Guide and a Game Master's Guide - each in only two pages!

In the Player's Guide you'll find:

Fast but detailed character creation rules
Action resolution rules
Combat!
Gear and Encumbrance rules
A slick freeform system for creating magical characters, from traditional wizards to exotic faeries
Alternative point-buy rules for character creation




In the Game Master's Guide you'll find

Additional rules for extended tasks, cooperative actions and more
Hazards: including poisons, diseases and environmental hazards
Rules to fully customize your heroes
A bestiary!
Optional rules
... and much more!




Bonus Character Sheet included!

168368.name: Adventurers! Creature Cards
168368.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome Adventurers!

Adventurers! is the new ultra-lite RPG from GRAmel. Made for Old School aficionados, it has a Player's Guide and a Game Master's Guide - each in only two pages!

In this product you'll find blank cards you can use to keep track of monsters' stats. They fit in a standard card case so you can quickly find each one when you need it.

168369.name: Adventurers! The Dungeon
168369.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome back to Adventurers! This time, we'll venture back to the very beginning of role playing games: dungeon crawling! In this rules-only supplement you'll find:

New combat options!
Six brand new Skills!
One new Power!
New items and rules to craft masterwork (or magical) items or generate one through heroic deeds!
Quick but complete rules to create a company of adventurers and build strongholds!
Custom rules to handle dungeon adventures!
24 new monsters!
Mass battle rules...




...and much, much more!

168370.name: Majestic Part 1: Alien Encounter
168370.description:
User Summary

Despite what you think, the game never did have a sequel. Nor was it really part of a series - though the company did make other games that can be seen as being part of the same universe as this one, and they do sort-of tie together.

The game starts with a fairly typical Sci-Fi premise: the luxury space cruiser, The S. S. Majestic, vanished on her maiden voyage. Now, years later, the derelict ship has been found! And, as the nearest archaeologist, you have been sent in to investigate!

An interesting part about this game is that the player never physically goes onto The Majestic. Yes, it is a 1st-Person adventure game, so you wouldn't see your character anyway... but this game does something unique. The player goes through the ship using a series of Nodes that were sent over to do the dangerous task of searching and scanning the wreck. The player can manipulate the Nodes - but two Nodes can never be in the same place at the same time. Switching between the Nodes to solve puzzles becomes a fairly large part of the game.

The player's job is to find out what really happened to The Majestic. Where is her captain? What about the two missing crew members? How did the rest of the crew manage to escape?

Questions will lead to more questions... and a truth that is far stranger than anything anyone imagined!

168371.name: Alida
168371.description:
Alida is a point and click interactive graphical adventure game. The story centres around four young men in the band Alida that attained phenomenal success with their first CD release. Loads of money coupled with wild imagination resulted in construction of "Alida" - the theme park.

It's an unusual place -

a giant guitar 330 metres long!

But these guys didn't stop there - the guitar can actually be played (assisted by machinery); the internal workings of the guitar can be accessed and manipulated (machine heads, switch, pots etc..)

As Alida was nearing completion things got complicated, their popularity was waning and money stopped coming in. Distrust set in. Each of the band members claimed different areas of Alida for themselves where they devised weird and elaborate systems to protect their wealth. They retracted from each other finally leaving Alida uninhabited.

Fifteen years later one of the guys is missing on Alida...

Source: The Developer Website.

168372.description: This mat provides placeholder positions for the cards during play. Card locations are numbered for easy identification. No more disorganized placement of cards. Neoprene quality construction.
168372.name: Machi Koro: Playmat

168373.name: ClockWerx
168373.description:
ClockWerx is a computer game created by Callisto Corporation that was released in 1995.

The game was originally released by Callisto under the name Spin Doctor. Later, with some game play enhancements, it was published by Spectrum HoloByte as Clockwerx.

The object of the game is to solve a series of increasingly difficult levels by swinging a rotating wand from dot to dot until the player reaches the "goal" dot. Enemy wands that kill the player if touched march in predetermined patterns around each level's grid. The design is such that, with careful timing, the player can swing through seemingly impassable groups of enemies. Players can also swing from the same dot as an enemy by staying on the opposite side of it, since most enemy wands rotate at the same speed. At higher levels, more enemies are introduced, such as doors that open and close when the player's wand passes over a switch, hyperdots that send players to a different dot, and drops of acid that follow the player around.

The player's wand is in continuous motion; the only control is to reverse its direction of rotation, or to swing to another dot. Players can also swing to another dot and reverse rotation at the same time. All player motion is controlled by just four keys (reverse direction immediately, "bounce" (reverse direction when your wand passes by another dot), move to another dot, and move and reverse direction simultaneously).

Source: Wikipedia, "ClockWerx", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

168374.name: Freakin' Funky Fuzzballs
168374.description:
User Summary

There is no easy way to describe this game. You play a Fuzzball. You are trying to collect key cards to go through elevators to the next level. You want to eat junk food, as it gives you health back. You want to collect rings, potions, armor, shields, and wands as power-ups. You want to avoid the evil creatures lurking on each map.

Most importantly, you don't want to trap yourself!

The levels are made up of patterns of tiles. There is only a certain number of times you can go across each tile before it disappears. Food and power-up items are hidden under tiles, while wands appear randomly in place of tiles during the game. When an item is taken, that tile immediately disappears.

So the trick is to find the elevator key card, and make it to the elevator without trapping yourself - but the more tiles you removed the higher your score. And let's not forget about the creatures chasing you!

The game did come with a two-player mode, which involves both players using the same keyboard and playing against each other at the same time. This was unique because it would alternate who played the Fuzzball, and who played the evil creatures. Each time the Fuzzball would die, the players would swap who controlled good and evil. Given how awkward that was, the game was usually played as a single-player game against the computer AI.

168375.name: The Rise of Tiamat Online Supplement
168375.description:
User summary:

Free PDF file detailing magic items, monsters, and spells from The Rise of Tiamat which are not included in the free Player's Basic Rules and Dungeon Master's Basic Rules downloads.

Version 1 released 29 October 2014 on Wizards of the Coast site (see weblink) in standard and "printer-friendly" forms. Version 2 released 5 November 2014.

168376.name: Word Bits
168376.description:
Challenge someone to a battle of words!

In Word Bits, words begin as one to four letter bits rolled on the letter dice. Pick a category card and make a word using those word bits that fit the category. Everyone plays at once, so be the first to call out your word to win the card. This game promotes quick thinking while building spelling and vocabulary skills

Turn over the top card. It will show how many dice to roll (from 1 to 4) and a general category. After throwing the dice,all players must quickly try to think of a single word that fits the category and includes all the letters shown. For example the two letters A and C and the category "Breakfast Food" might lead to "bacon", "cereal", "pancakes" or even "cantaloupe". The fastest player receives the card and then turns over a card for the next round. At the end of the deck, the player who collected the most cards wins the game.

168377.name: The Legend of The Artifact
168377.description:
User Summary

The Legend of The Artifact is a platformer with some fighting elements. for up to 4 players. A golden treasure called The Artifact is keeping the land in peace. An evil wizard has stolen The Artifact. According to the legend four heroes saved the land the last it happened and it will up to four new heroes to stop the wizard now.

168378.name: Victim of Xen
168378.description:
User Summary

Follow the story of Will, as he is turned into a girl by royal witch, Xen. Explore a dynamic story set in a rich world full of war and intrigue, as you search of a way to reverse the spell. Fight monsters and complete jobs to earn coin.

168379.name: Konung: Legends of the North
168379.description:
Konung: Legends of the North is a role-playing video game (CRPG) developed by Strategy First and released in 2000 by 1C. The game takes place in the 7th century in Scandinavia, a world full of legends and myths. The main character looks for three pieces of an amulet to open a gate that leads to a mighty dragon, who defends the "Bracelet of Dominion".

Source: Wikipedia, "Konung: Legends of the North", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

168380.name: Konung 2: Blood of Titans
168380.description:
Konung 2 is a sequel to Konung: The Legend of North. According to the storyline Good and Evil traded places. The main hero that won a victory over the forces of Evil in the first part of the game has got under the influence of a very powerful magic artifact -- Sovereign bracelet. The hero became the dark Master, the biggest threat for his land. His mind is completely controlled by the bracelet and he is trying to subdue all other magic artifacts.

Only six heroes, descendants of the Titans, can stop him. They must be fearless and very cautious. Their enemies are not only bloodthirsty monsters but Master's warriors as well. Their task is hard but it's the only way to save their land.

The world of Konung is a unique and spacious fantasy land, that combines parts of known history with classical myths and the legends of the Chronicles, including immortal heroes, magical artefacts and ancient sorcery. The whole world is shaped by three cultures on the verge of the second millennium: tribes of wild Slavic hunters, noble traders of the still-powerful Byzantine Empire, and fearless Viking warriors.

Features


Unique Fantasy world settled in an atmosphere of myths and the legends of tribes of wild Slavic hunters, noble traders of the still-powerful Byzantine Empire, and fearless Viking warriors
Six different heroes, male and female warriors
Improved RPG system, wide range of character skills an characteristics
Detailed dialogue system
Dozens of quests
Improved AI
Outdoor and indoor locations
Improved fighting technique
New monsters
Settlement management

168381.name: Bright Mountain Valley & the Town of Brighton
168381.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two thousand years ago the cataclysmic event known as the Shattering occurred, fracturing the planet of Celmae into its current, sundered state. The dwarves of ancient times dug too deep, releasing a force mighty enough to shatter the world.

For centuries the people had to adapt to their new surroundings before they could advance their cultures again. In the town of Brighton, located in the center of the continent of Brynndell by the sinister Bright Mountain, politics at court can be just as dangerous as surrounding decapus infested forest.

But an ancient evil has awoken deep in the heart of the valley and the foul taint of this eldritch terror threatens to engulf the continent in un-imaginable horror.

The Shattered Skies of Celmae needs Heroes. Are you brave enough to heed the call?

168382.description:
Night Fight: Solitaire East Front Tactics is a solitaire wargame in which you command a Kampfgruppe group of German panzers infiltrating and attacking Soviet forces at night while the system runs the Soviet forces. The first scenario is based on an actual night action from the Battle of Kursk during elements of 6th Panzer Division infiltrated behind Soviet lines. There are also several other scenarios representing other night fights on the eastern front in 1943.

Each vehicle counter represents up to five tanks or other vehicles, depending on the scenario. Each map hex represents 30 meters. Each turn represents anywhere from two to 15 minutes depending on the tempo of your activities.
168382.name: Night Fight: Solitaire East Front Tactics

168383.description:
Panzers East Solitaire (PES) is simulation that covers the advance of Germany’s Army Group Center, starting on the first day of Operation Barbarossa and potentially extending to the last day of August later that same summer. The design supports both strict historical and alternative history explorations. That is, at the end of July, when the AGC offensive was historically shut down in favor of supporting extended drives by the flanking army groups, it’s possible that, if you’ve done better up to then than your historical counterpart, Hitler may authorize a continued and immediate advance on Moscow. You command the German forces while the system directs the handling of Soviet forces. You win or lose based on the timely seizure of key areas on the map.

Each game turn equals one-third of a month. Each hexagon represents 16 miles (24 km) from side to opposite side.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters
168383.name: Panzers East Solitaire

168384.name: Emergence Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook
168384.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the year 1982, Earth’s destiny was forever altered by the swing of a hammer.

A simple mining operation led to an unprecedented discovery: the Infinity Stone, a stone with an impossible number of facets, emanating an intense inner glow and inscribed in an unknown language. This beautiful, alien object changed everything, for it was a window to other realities, allowing glimpses of what might be or could have been.

Years of exhausting — and sometimes disastrous — experimentation culminated in a discovery beyond imagination: the stone opened a portal to a mystical world teeming with life, full of clean air and azure skies. In this world, our fantasies were reality. Legendary creatures roamed the land and sky, while elves, dwarves, and orcs inhabited the land in place of humans. It is in man’s nature to explore the unknown, to know what lies beyond…and so blindly humanity plunged…

Emergence is an exciting, easy-to-learn roleplaying game that takes place on the Earth-like world of Kython.

Emergence blends elements your favorite games into a single cohesive setting. The heart of the game world mostly resembles that of modern earth, but as you venture away from this comfortable and familiar center, different genre components shift in prominence. High fantasy, sci-fi, horror, dark science, occult, and post apocalyptic settings all shine through in the final vision of the world.

Through this interplay of genres you can insert all the fantastical elements that make you love roleplaying games, into a world that you already know. This eliminates most of the learning curve of the setting, allowing you and your group to get into the action faster.

Mechanically, Emergence is as rich and varied as the setting in which it takes place. Emergence places a high value on player choice. You can customize nearly every facet of your character, along with his gear, vehicles, mounts and body. Below are some of the options and features included in the Core Rulebook and that make Emergence the game you and your group will love for years to come:

Determine all rolls through a simple system using only three six-sided dice
Engage in an exciting, fast-moving combat system that encourages immersion and creative thinking
Gain a broad knowledge of Kython through background information for dozens of locales and governments
Create a unique racial makeup by combining elements of the four player races from a pool of over 50 racial traits
Represent your base experiences through 16 character backgrounds
Use diverse and broad skills to specialize while maintaining a sense of versatility
Construct incredibly diverse characters using specialized abilities from 33 talent trees and over 650 talents and benefits
Customize your equipment and vehicles through systems that allow thousands of combinations
Forge your body and spirit into whatever you can imagine using four complete systems for Augmentation—Cybernetics, Fleshweaving, Runescribing, and Magic Items
Garner advice and rules for creating environments, quests, adventures, and campaigns in the Game Mastering chapter
Create opponents and character companions using quick, simple rules that also allow for virtually unlimited combinations and possibilities




So grab some friends and some dice, and bring your imaginations………. Adventure Awaits!!!

168385.description:
It was the Chinese scholar-historian Wei Yuan, writing in the mid-19th century, who first formally identified his nation’s apparently inescapable cycles of “chaos and humiliation” (quru), followed by “rejuvenation” (fuxiang), followed by “wealth and power” (fuqiang), and then back to quru to start again. More recently, Queens College futurist and sometimes-CIA analyst Dr. Bruce Bueno de Mosquita wrote concerning China that he sees no factors in the present-day environment working to end or deflect that same cycle. It was the shared conclusions of those two men, working over a century-and-a-half apart, which inspired me to design this wargame modeling the military parameters and possibilities inherent in the next phase of Chinese quru – civil war.

The likely starting points for such a conflict would either be the collapse of the Chinese real estate bubble – which is already broadly predicted to be inescapable and will constitute the largest financial collapse in world history – or the growing potable water crisis. (A third of the water consumed by the Chinese is undrinkable by US standards.) Beyond those factors, or in combination with them, there’s also the gender imbalance, the fossil fuel air pollution crisis, the increasingly endemic corruption, the aging population structure, the expanding rural-urban economic gap, as well as the general collapse of ideology and the resultant moral lapse throughout the populace. One, some, or all of these factors may eventually lead to a crisis in China, as so often occurs in history, resulting in a civil war.

Each turn equals two months, probably starting sometime late in this decade or early in the next. The game is designed for two players, but it is adaptable for solitaire. Each hexagon on the 34x22” map represents 80 miles from side to opposite side. Units of maneuver are brigades, divisions and group armies and air corps (in the form of 176 large-size NATO-style counters).

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

Modern War #19, Sept-Oct 2015
168385.name: Red Dragon Falling

168386.name: Within a Heart of Darkness
168386.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within a Heart of Darkness is an adventure supplement for the Emergence Roleplaying Game that continues the events of the sample adventure “When Things Go Bump” from the Core Rulebook.

Despite achieving victory over the murderers and thieves of “When Things Go Bump,” it was clear to all that more nefarious elements were at work behind the scenes. Throughout this adventure the heroes will attempt to track Azul, the mysterious figure from the final showdown of their last mission.

They will face foes both mundane and exotic while traveling to multiple locales throughout the S.E.A. and the Verge. They will seek to uncover the truth of their enemies’ plans and the identity of Kerrath, the enigmatic master of their quarry. Their task will not be easy, but the measure of a hero can be no greater than that of his enemies.

This adventure is intended for 3-6 players of 2nd level. The PC’s will advance to approximately 5th level over the course of 5-6 average length game sessions.

168387.name: Autumn Cemetery
168387.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 32 x 30 inch Battlemap of an Autumn Cemetery, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“What do you mean I am dead?”

DramaScape dares you to enter our Autumn Cemetery for your Halloween-themed games this year! A combination of fallen foliage from trees and creepy mausoleums and coffins make this map perfect for Horror games set in autumn.

Autumn Cemetery is a single exterior map of a well-maintained cemetery in the midst of fall season. The wind continues to howl and blow leaves all over the cemetery from the trees, much to the chagrin of the caretakers.

Autumn Cemetery is intended for use in horror and modern settings. It could also be easily used in fantasy settings as a cemetery with a high degree of reverence for those interred there explaining its well-maintained state.

Adventure Hook for use with this map:

Dead Man Talking: A local man was recently found dead under mysterious circumstances and then buried in the local cemetery. The locals say that they have seen this dead man lurking about town at night time. The player characters are playing detectives trying to figure out who murdered the man. With little evidence of foul play from the autopsy, they might decide to investigate the rumors.

While in town at night, they see a man matching the dead man’s physical appearance wandering around town. He stops around his former house and gropes at the door handle of his own home, moaning in frustration that he is barred entry from his home. He then walks back to the cemetery glumly.
If the group follows him, they find that he is not alone. Many men and women are wandering around the old cemetery in various states of decay. If they see the detectives they wander up to them and moan in frustration as if trying to communicate but don’t attack them unless provoked. The detectives might recognize them as other people who were found dead of mysterious circumstances in the last year.

When the recently dead man sees them he walks up to them and starts talking! He wants to know what happened to his possessions like his keys and wallet. He needs his keys to get back into his house and stop squatting in this cemetery.

The player characters can explain that he is dead, which makes the dead man confused and possibly angry, since he doesn’t seem to realize he is dead. Or they can bluff him, pretending they have his keys and wallet and they’ll give them back after a few questions, maybe even promising to take him to the police station to give them back to him. The dead man doesn’t remember too much as if he has amnesia, but he might be able to reveal some clues about his killer, a witch doctor using drugs or herbs to kill people that then cause them to be brought back as zombies with the proper ritual. Those resurrected this way have some consciousness left, but it quickly fades away over time.

Another murder occurs in the next week unless the group confronts the witch doctor before then. The witch doctor is seen there at the funeral. If the group goes to the cemetery that very night, they can see the witch doctor performing a ritual surrounded by his human cronies and zombie thralls. It is time to stop the witch doctor lest he raise another zombie. His talking zombies apologize or look sad as they try to fight the group. When the witch doctor is defeated, the talking zombie thanks the group and other zombies seem to smile before walking to their coffins to finally rest in peace.

168388.description:
Objective: As a hero - collect as much gold as possible;
as dragon - catch all heros; game ends after all gold is collected or all heros are caught/out of the game.
- acting by turns -
The dragon is placed in the centre of the board, each hero with two pieces of gold on his starting position; remaining gold (4 pieces) are placed at the far end of the cave.
Players move according die roll forward, laterally or backwards.
A '6' can be used only passing (stepping over) the dragon, otherwise not usable. Reaching a piece of gold it should be brought back to starting position.
After each player's turn the dragon will move segmentally according die roll. A player hit by dragon's head is out of the game - unless he/she can pay a ransom (1 gold).

note:
likely published mid 1950's
168388.name: Der Kampf mit dem Drachen

168389.name: RHEM
168389.description:
By the time you see this message I will have been long gone from RHEM. If fate has kept you a prisoner here I can offer you the opportunity to return to your own world. But I will need your help. In RHEM is a letter I have written to my brother. If you help me get this letter to my brother ZETAIS I can help you get back to your world.

A rich and complex place with its own rules.
On a quest to uncover the secrets of a mysterious letter.
A journey - you arrive, a stranger in a strange land.

When you start the game, the opening movie will run and you will be transported to the land of RHEM. The car has been commandeered and you must sit tight in one spot, momentarily unable to leave. It roams about RHEM and discovers the mysteries of this place little by little. The only possibility of a return home is a letter, which consists of four hidden fragments, which it must not only find but also put together. RHEM is a rich and complex place with its own logic and rules, but where every element and environment has been created with a purpose.

Source: The Developer Website.

168390.description:
Set Schnupperspiel or Set Demo Deck is a small, promotional copy of Set! containing 27 cards.

In SET, each card contains 1-3 objects, with all of the objects on a card having the same color, shape and shading. Colours, shapes, and shadings come in three different types: green, purple and red; oval, diamond and squiggle. As opposed to the original game, there is only one type of shading; solid.

The object of the game is to create sets of 3 cards that are either all alike or all different.

The Set Schnupperspiel, or Set Demo Deck, was available at the AMIGO Spiel + Freizeit GmbH booth, at Spiel '14, as a freebie.
168390.name: Set Schnupperspiel

168391.description:
User Description

The White Dwarf expansion for Cosmic Encounter has four new Alien Powers cards for the Games Workshop edition of Cosmic Encounter (2nd edition).

Published in the White Dwarf magazine, issue 78 with an article about Cosmic Encounter and its history.

All four of the Alien Powers cards have been republished in a later edition of Cosmic Encounter.

The Alien Powers Cards are:

Reincarnator - Uses Powers not in the game
Changeling - Changes Powers with opponents
Warrior - Adds experience points
Grudge - Penalizes for refusing to ally
168391.name: Cosmic Encounter: White Dwarf Magazine Expansion

168392.name: RHEM 3
168392.description:
Hello my friend. A while ago you gave me a photograph of a relic from the caves of Rhem. I am writing you this letter to let you know that I have deciphered the drawing on the relic. With this information you can now explore an unknown part of Rhem. The enclosed note holds the key to your entry. Thank you for your help. Good luck on your journey.

On your arrival you meet Kales who has discovered that a mysterious artefact, a black gem, is hidden somewhere on Rhem. Because the doorway must be opened by two persons but remains open just long enough for only one person to slip through, you are the only one accessing this new part of the island. Again, on your own you must uncover these new secrets of Rhem.

You will soon find out that the mysterious black gem is not the only mystery on Rhem. You will discover new passages to unknown but also to familiar and well-known places on Rhem. To find the black gem you must for one uncover the hints hidden in the secret library. But you will also need the help of some other characters to solve all the mysterious of Rhem. Some of these characters, like the redcapped Cavemen, you already met in Rhem 2. But this time they will ask something of you in return for their help.

Rhem 3: The Secret Library sets you into a huge, fantastic world full of strange vehicles and buildings, unknown mechanisms and machines, secret passages and doorways. Adventuresomeness, logic, attentivness and the ability to solve engimas will help the player to slowly but surely unveil the mystery of this new adventure on Rhem. Everywhere on Rhem you can find hints and solutions that will help you to unveil some of the strange enigmas and puzzles in Rhem 3. And remember, finding the black gem can be the final discovery in Rhem 3, but it must not be...

Source: The Developer Website.

168393.name: The Shab Al-Hiri Roach (Gamechef edition)
168393.description:
website blurb (1KM1KT):
The Shab-al-Hiri Roach is a dark comedy of manners, lampooning academia and asking players to answer a difficult question – are you willing to swallow a soul-eating telepathic insect bent on destroying human civilization?

No?

Even if it will get you tenure?

user comment:
This is the original, Gamechef 2005 edition of the rules. The game is presented as 32 pages of rules and 7 pages of cards.

168394.name: RHEM 4
168394.description:
Since you were last here I have discovered an entrance to yet another new part of RHEM. According to records I've found, there is a hidden transportation system that leads to a second connection to the outside world. In order to activate this system and also to enable your own return, you must find all nine fragments of the key to the system...

A few days ago, I arrived in this part of Rhem. I will set up a studio for myself here. I have not been able to find the star key, but it appears I first have to look for nine fragments. Near the railway line, I found a box to collect the fragments in. Some entrances to some of the buildings could be opened, but at the moment, I can't make any further progress...

In a straw-roofed hut, there is a fireplace where some missing parts can be joined together. I'll lock the hut again but will leave behind clues about how to open the door...

An unexpected success! By chance, I discovered the key to a cave system where there is yet another gate with a star lock. Unfortunately, I can't open the gate...

Rhem 4: The Golden Fragments sets you into a huge, fantastic world full of strange vehicles and buildings, unknown mechanisms and machines, secret passages and doorways. Adventuresomeness, logic, attentivness and the ability to solve engimas will help the player to slowly but surely unveil the mystery of this new adventure on Rhem. Everywhere on Rhem you can find hints and solutions that will help you to unveil some of the strange enigmas and puzzles in Rhem 4.

Source: The Developer Website.

168395.name: HârnWorld Master Module Third Edition
168395.description:
Publisher blurb:

HârnWorld is a detailed, realistic, flexible, and system-neutral setting for fantasy role-playing games. Since 1983, HârnWorld has been used by thousands of people across the world to run a wide array of medieval fantasy adventures. HârnWorld can accommodate whatever style of campaign you are looking for, whether your player characters are knights, mages, barbarians, clerics, noble lords, mercenaries, gladiators, craftsmen, merchants, thieves, or even simple peasants yearning for adventure.

This basic HârnWorld module has two components:

Hârn Overview: This 58-page Hârn article is a general overview of Hârnic cultures, governments, economics, history, and more. It also includes campaign aids for such tasks as generating weather conditions and character backgrounds.

Hârn Regional Map: The map of Hârn provides a vast amount of information with a unique cartographic system developed specifically for fantasy gaming. The area detailed measures 620×930 miles (1000×1500 km). The colors and textures show vegetation and terrain as noted on the map key.

168396.name: Milecastle 42 (Savage Worlds)
168396.description:
publisher blurb

During the 16th year of the reign of Tiberius, a great star fell from the heavens which brought death to the living and life to the dead. Ten years later, Caligula created a wall made of milecastles and men to stand between the Empire and the Undead of the East. You are stationed at Milecastle 41. Last night the watch fire at Milecastle 42 went from normal to danger and then went out.

168397.name: Dreamraiders
168397.description:
De la web del editor:

LA REALIDAD ESTÁ EN JUEGO TUS SUEÑOS SON EL CAMPO DE BATALLA

Durante tres largos días, siete mil millones de personas fueron incapaces de dormir. Muchos creen que aquel fenómeno inexplicable fue un incidente aislado; que todo volvió a la normalidad tras acabar aquellas setenta y dos horas de insomnio global.

Se equivocan.

La Gran Vigilia fue solo el primer disparo en una contienda invisible. Una guerra en la que se decide el destino de nuestra realidad... y en la que tú estás a punto de tomar partido.

DREAMRAIDERS es un juego de rol completo que contiene todo lo necesario para embarcar a tus jugadores en un viaje a través de infinidad de mundos oníricos. En él encontrarás...

- Un innovador sistema de reglas capaz de plasmar cualquier universo que puedas imaginar, así como los inmensos poderes de creación (y destrucción) al alcance de aquellos que se adentran en el mundo de los sueños.
- Una mecánica de juego versátil y completa para los jugadores pero muy ligera de cara al Director de Juego, minimizando su tiempo de cálculos y fórmulas al mínimo, permitiendo que centre toda su creatividad y atención en sus jugadores.
- Un sistema de creación (y desarrollo) de personajes que convierte cada sesión de juego en una fuente inagotable de sorpresas.
- Una campaña de iniciación donde comienza una guerra invisible que pondrá en jaque la realidad tal y como la conocemos.
- Tres modalidades distintas de juego, con reglas adaptadas para cada una de ellas: únete a quienes protegen la realidad del caos (Dreamraiders), toma partido por aquellos que luchan para escapar de ella (Dreamriders) ¡o enfrenta ambas facciones en la modalidad crossover!
- Las reglas opcionales Dream&Play que permiten jugar sin Director de Juego de forma prácticamente inmediata y sin apenas preparación previa por parte del grupo de juego.
- Soñar Despierto, una aventura introductoria que sienta las bases de lo que, en términos televisivos, sería la “primera temporada” de una serie.

From publishers website (Google translated from Spanish to English):

REALITY IS AT STAKE YOUR DREAMS ARE THE BATTLEFIELD

For three long days, seven billion people were unable to sleep. Many believe that this unexplained phenomenon was an isolated incident; everything returned to normal after finishing those seventy-two hours global insomnia.

They are wrong.

The Great Vigil was just the first shot in an invisible war. A war in which the fate of our reality ... and decide where you're about to take sides.

DREAMRAIDERS is a full RPG containing everything you need for your players embark on a journey through endless dream worlds.

168398.name: Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail
168398.description:
Around the time of the Civil War and following, the American West was certainly a wild place. Although it was sparsely populated, many of the inhabitants were desperate and dangerous. The West had always been home to large groups of American natives, but now had been receiving various undesirables such as cattle rustlers, gamblers, vigilantes, and banditos. For the most part, those coming West were hungry for gold and were willing to do just about anything to get it. Many found it too tiresome trying to get rich panning and digging, and instead found it more convenient to steal or kill for it. As a consequence, it became the common practice not only for nearly everyone to carry a firearm, but also for nearly everyone to use one. Needless to say gangs, posses, and gunfights were common parts of every day life. Anybody with a gun had an opportunity to make a name and gain infamy in the great American West.

It is exactly this setting in which you find yourself in. You have the option of choosing one of seven notorious gunfighters of the old American West: Kid Rango, Chief War Wind, Pablo ‘The Pistol’ Perez, Walter Winston, Raging Arrow, Luther ‘The Lawman’ Hale, or Little Pancho. Besides the 7 posse bosses, Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail also comes with an additional 42 gunfighters. Each boss and gunfighter comes with their own mugshot and unique battle stats. With your posse boss, recruit a gang from the various cities to ride out to face your rivals. Dodge ruthless banditos, determined lawmen, and hostile natives to get to your next gig. You can knock off the Bank of the Nation, rustle up some cattle, or take on the Union Pacific Railroad. You can also track down the other gunslingers to collect the bounties on their heads. The way you stack your posse, the strategy you employ, and knowing when to strike will always give you the edge. Each boss comes with his own clutch skills that come in handy when the chips are down. No matter how many times you play, the scenarios are endless and the game never looks the same twice. The winner is the posse that bags the most gold, even if they end up in pine boxes.

With Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail, you get three distinct games in the Gunslinger series. You get everything you need to play Gunslinger Shootout (arena style combat), Gunslinger Showdown (mano y mano confrontation), and Gunslinger Roundup (recruit your posse, collect the bounties, and get the gold). Anybody can get lucky and be a hero! It takes one shot in the right spot.

168399.name: Hearts of Iron IV

videogamehonor.39226: 2016 Global Game Awards Best PC Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee

168399.description:
You are now in command of World War II! Your ability to lead your nation is your supreme weapon, the strategy game Hearts of Iron IV by Paradox Development Studio lets you take command of any nation in World War II; the most engaging conflict in world history.

Description

From the heart of the battlefield to the command center, you will guide your nation to glory and wage war, negotiate or invade. You hold the power to tip the very balance of WWII. It is time to show your ability as the greatest military leader in the world. Will you relive or change history? Will you change the fate of the world?

Features

Total strategic war – The war is not only won on land, on the seas and in the air, but also in the laboratories, the factories, the backrooms, in international trade and in the hearts and minds of men and women.
The most authentic real-time simulation of the war – Let the greatest commanders of WW2 fight your war with the tools of the time; tanks, planes, ships, guns and newly discovered weapons of mass destruction.
Fight as any nation in the greatest human conflict of all time – Chose from the greatest powers striving for victory, or the small nations trying to weather the storm.

Source: The Publisher Website.

168400.name: Cool Pizza
168400.description:
A girl and her haunted skateboard dive through the depths of the underworld, fighting devils and looking for answers. Can pizza ever be cool?

Cool Pizza is a spastic screen-masher inspired by Space Harrier and After Burner.

Source: The Developer Website.

168401.description:
Ideal for small tournament or casual play support.

(8) Fortress Oblivion cards (2) Starbase Omega cards

Star Realms is a space combat deckbuilding game designed by Magic Pro Tour Champions and Hall of Famers Darwin Kastle and Rob Dougherty (developer and cofounder of the Ascension Deckbuilding Game).

Enjoy the thrill fo TCG-Style combat in a deckbuilding game. Play powerful ships, destroy enemy bases, and blast your opponent directly on the way to victory!
168401.name: Star Realms: Game Day Pack (Season 2)

168402.name: Persona Q: Shadow Of The Labyrinth

videogamehonor.31972: 2014 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

168402.description:
Do you know the Seven Horrors of Yasogami High?
Whoever hears the bells of the clock tower will die...

Persona Q: Shadow Of The Labyrinth is the latest Persona title, incorporating the gameplay style previously unique to the Etrian Odyssey series. This game is an exclusive Nintendo 3DS-exclusive RPG created by the Persona team and dedicated to all RPG fans.

The Persona-users cross time and space to assemble as a new tale unfolds...

Source: The Game Website.

168403.name: Dreamfall Chapters - Book One: Reborn
168403.description:
Dreamfall Chapters is the long awaited episodic follow-up to the award-winning and bestselling adventure games The Longest Journey and Dreamfall: The Longest Journey.

An exciting story-driven episodic adventure for Windows/Mac/Linux and PlayStation 4, Dreamfall Chapters follows three characters on their journeys across two worlds — one a cyberpunk vision of the future, the other a magical fantasy world — as their stories and destinies intertwine.

Source: The Game Website.

168404.name: Eden's Quest: The Hunt for Akua

videogameversion.257698: Eden's Quest: The Hunt for Akua

168404.description:
Eden Hunt, a famous archaeologist, had received a call from a mysterious man, the promoter of a treasure hunt, with a very large sum of money at stake! A godsend for Eden who wants to go digging. While all this is strange, she accepts...

The initial goal of the player is to answer the puzzles to find the fabulous treasure of Akua. But sabotage and troubling disappearances will complicate everything, making the protagonists of this hunt more and more suspicious...

Source: The Developer Website.

168405.name: Cobi Treasure Deluxe
168405.description:
User Summary

In this game you will help Sally the seahorse collect and match ocean treasures before they fall to the seabed. There's three game modes.

168406.name: What da Blank
168406.description:
Overview
What Da Blank is a question-based card game where you and your friends are put in messed up situations and you get to come up with the best or worst answers or stories to make your friends laugh their butts off! It's really a game for friends to have laughter-filled, honest, friendship-insulting fun!

Rules
1. The player with the least hair will start the game by taking a card form the top of the deck.
2. The player will then read the question to the group, replacing the blank with his/her name.
3. The other players will then take turns to give their best/most messed up answers they can think of.
4. The player will then pick the answer that he/she feels is the best answer and awards that person the card.
5. The next player will then take another card from the deck and the game continues.

Win Condition
The first player to get 3 cards wins the game! When a player has won, all cards will return to the deck and the deck will be reshuffled to "reset" the game.

Minus Cards
If any player draws a minus card, they must return the minus card and any two cards on their hand to the bottom of the deck. That player's turn is now over and the next player continues the game by taking a card from the deck.

Community Aspect
What makes What da Blank special is that most (if not all) the questions in the game were conceived from the creators' friends! Seeing this, the creators want to incorporate more questions into future expansions by getting crazy questions from the community to make a game that is truly community-inspired!

168407.name: Spy Genre Charts
168407.description:
User Summary:

An expansion pack for The Covetous Poet's Adventure Creator and Solo GM Guidebook that adds charts for spy-genre role-playing games.

From the Introduction:

The Spy Genre Charts are for roleplaying games of spies, secret agents, and international intrigue. Players who are creating games of espionage and secret intelligence should use these charts to create their adventures.

168408.description:
Non-CCG card game for two people.

Explore the world in which swords chop to the left and right, while men screaming off their lungs. World of mighty Karmazyns and Brotherhood. World of XVII-century Poland. World of Noble Card Game VETO!

Starting the game in Veto The confrontation, you can choose whether you stand on the side of a knightly family of Michael Volodyovski headed, or insidious Radziwill, where the first saber is Andrew Kmicic. Your actions can support Jeremy Wiśniowiecki or treacherous brothers Radziwill in the struggle for the throne of Poland. By hook or by crook you will agitate and challenge to duels their rivals.

Do not have pity for the vanquished! Grab throne for yourself!

This is a standalone game, based on CCG Szlachecka Gra Karciana VETO! (Noble Card Game VETO!) and contains two complete decks of 55 cards, 28 ducat tokens, 15 stroke tokens and instruction.

----- Polish genuine description -----

Poznaj świat, w którym szablami rąbie się na lewo i prawo, gardłując przy tym wniebogłosy. Świat możnych Karmazynów i odważnych Panów Braci. Świat XVII-wiecznej Polski. Świat Szlacheckiej Gry Karcianej VETO!

Zaczynając grę w Veto Konfrontacja, możesz wybrać, czy staniesz po stronie rycerskiego rodu Wiśniowieckich z Michałem Wołodyjowskim na czele, czy podstępnych Radziwiłłów, gdzie pierwszą szablą jest Andrzej Kmicic. Twoje działania mogą wesprzeć Jeremiego Wiśniowieckiego bądź zdradzieckich braci Radziwiłłów w walce o tron Rzeczypospolitej. Nie przebierając w środkach będziesz agitował i wyzywał na pojedynki swoich rywali.

Nie miej litości dla pokonanych! Zagarnij tron dla siebie!

Gra zawiera: dwie kompletne talie po 55 kart, 28 żetonów dukatów, 15 żetonów kresek oraz instrukcję.
168408.name: VETO Konfrontacja

168409.name: Reise ins Alpenland
168409.description:
A roll and move game with numbered spaces by Otto Maier Verlag. Players start at the first space and must follow the numbered spaces in towards the center space. First one to reach the end space is the winner.

The company published a similar game/similar equipment: Reise durch die Schweiz;
due to the used logo ist must have been published earlier than 1892

168410.description: This Adventure Path Set (#3) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Free Kingdoms and the other is Deverenian.
168410.name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – The Temple of Eternal Flame

168411.name: Hell on Earth: Reloaded Companion
168411.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s lonely in the Wastes…take a Companion!

The Hell on Earth Companion gives your scav what she needs to become an honest-to-Oppenheimer cyborg and adds two new Arcane Backgrounds: Librarian and Witch. For those looking for less weird in their Wasted West there’s plenty of guns and gear, details on the dangers of the irradiated future, vehicle combat, and how to contact a lonely AI in the sky.

The Marshal will enjoy twisted takes on the Adventure Generator and Survivor Settlements to help put some flesh on that husk of a campaign, not to mention a few new things to go bump in the night.

168412.name: Hell on Earth: Reloaded - The Worms' Turn
168412.description:
From back cover:

Something lurks beneath the irradiated soil. Something ancient and evil.

The Worms’ Turn is a full-length Plot Point Campaign featuring the aftermath of the climactic battle called “The Harvest.” The Reckoners have been banished to the distant living planet of Banshee, but there’s no time for celebration. The Iron Alliance has learned a terrifying secret—the Reckoners were keeping other, even older terrors in check.

The Worms’ Turn contains a full-length campaign, updates on the events of the Wasted West, and numerous Savage Tales that can be inserted into your own tales of wasteland woe.

168413.name: La Bruja
168413.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 15-page Creature Feature contains more information on the Mexican witches known as “la bruja,” as well as Savage Tales and Figure Flats for the most unwholesome señoritas at ETU!

168414.name: Maggie's Ghost
168414.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maggie's Ghost is a free One Sheet adventure for East Texas University, a setting of college horror for Savage Worlds by 12 to Midnight and Pinnacle Entertainment Group.

Is there really a ghost haunting the Film Making program, or is it all just special effects gone awry? If so, who’s behind it, and what’s the real truth? Can you handle the truth…or will it handle you?

168415.name: Jack's Back
168415.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jack's Back is a free One Sheet adventure for East Texas University, a setting of college horror and hijinks for Savage Worlds by 12 to Midnight and Pinnacle Entertainment Group.

Legendary partier Jack Brown has returned to ETU to finish his degree, but things aren't going so well. At least, they weren't until he turned to a terribly twisted tutor to help him out. But it seems everyone is paying the price for Jack's extracurricular help...

168416.name: Brewhaha
168416.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brewhaha is a free One Sheet adventure for East Texas University, a setting of college horror and hijinks for Savage Worlds by 12 to Midnight and Pinnacle Entertainment Group.

The bruja from Jack's Back is back! And this time she's got her vicious claws in Jason Hess, a struggling brewmeister in Pinebox, Texas. What happens when the locals get a couple of mugs of his best-selling Brazen Hussy brew in them? Find out in this twisted tale of terror and debauchery!

168417.name: Shock Jock
168417.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shock Jock is a free One Sheet adventure for East Texas University, a setting of college horror and hijinks for Savage Worlds by 12 to Midnight and Pinnacle Entertainment Group.

In this tale, KETU's newest late night DJ and talk show host, Wes Goodwin himself, seems to have a powerful effect on his listeners. Some of them even commit murder.Does Goodwin have some strange power? Or is he a victim himself? Find out in this creepy One Sheet of campus mayhem and malevolence!

168418.name: Pinebox, Texas: Chamber of Commerce
168418.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a map of Pinebox, Texas, for use with the East Texas University roleplaying game.

168419.name: East Texas University Campus Map
168419.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a map of the East Texas University Campus, for use with the East Texas University roleplaying game.

168420.name: Grand Safari
168420.description:
From publisher blurb:

Restless? Bored? In need of adventure?

Fret no more! Join the Grand Safari!

Grand Safari is a campaign featuring six short adventure scenarios which will challenge any traveller. The Safari, sponsored by the Gentlemen's Club of Dashwood, send the characters into the wilds of the untamed Hannibal Subsector. There the characters will both work together to face challenges and compete against one another to win the Grand Safari Prize!

Grand Safari also features information on the systems of the Hannibal Subsector.
